campaign.story:
Many thanks to all 3800+ backers for making this project successful!  Delivery of Wave 1 is coming in August 2020 and Wave 2 is scheduled for November 2020!  We are so thankful!  For any issues please email to support@maydaygames.com!
Did you miss the project?  You can late pledge for a few days after the campaign is over HERE.  Once our late-pledge option closes you can still order from us directly HERE.
If you are a backer and haven't filled out your survey, the survey retrieval link is HERE. Note this link will only work starting 2 weeks after the campaign closes and while the survey is open.  
Not sure about Crokinole?  Watch Shup Up & Sit Down's review of the game!  (Note their review is of a different board, we have tried to get them one of ours but no luck yet!).  
 Introduction
Mayday is the authority on Crokinole in the U.S. In fact this will be our 7th Crokinole version since we started making Crokinole boards over 8 years ago. We have sold thousands of boards across the world! We are the only company in the USA offering Crokinole boards at affordable prices. The production runs of these boards are crazy and who knows what tariffs charges and COVID-19 issues will do to future production runs. Shipping costs are very expensive this year so we are limiting the delivery of this game to just a few countries.
Not sure how to play?  Take 5 minutes and watch this video.  This is one of the easiest games to learn and great for people just getting into board games.
 You can check out our last three Crokinole board offerings from 2019 (HERE), 2018 (HERE ), 2016 (HERE), and 2013 (HERE) on Kickstarter. So why are we back again? In a word: Quality. How good is it? Listen to the last 90 seconds of this review OF 2016 THE ACTUAL FINISHED PRODUCT from our 2016 offering!
Why is this review relevant? Because after using several different factories, we found one that produces our product up to our strictest specifications. While every printing has gone well, most have not been good enough to merit going back, we always thought we could improve. Finally, the factory really came through for us in 2016 and 2019 and we are using them again! We are the ONLY quality choice for Crokinole boards in the U.S.
"I love my Mayday board. It’s my first. Got it on kickstarter. It’s still in great shape and I love introducing new people to the game. It’s often asked for on game night. I keep it in the travel case I bought for it under my guest room bed to keep it safe and flat. I’m also grateful to Mayday for letting me into this game at a price point I could handle. " - Mark Halsey, Toledo Ohio (BGG User Quoted HERE)
Why Back Now?
 Best Pricing!  If you haven't heard, the US dollar is super strong. (OK, I'm a finance geek who likes board games.) Our Crokinole boards have retailed for under $200 for years and due to the strong US dollar we are able to maintain our low price for another round. Who knows where things will go in the future?! For now, we can guarantee that regardless of the markets, the price will not increase for you backers! 
Why so cheap? We bring them in by the shipping container.
 Very Limited Quantity! We had just 1,250 boards available and we just can't promise when we will make another batch. It may be another 6 months or 3 years and the price may certainly go up! These will NOT be available in stores!  We can fit 850 in a container so that is all we can commit to, plus the ones we are shipping internationally.  Note: On Day 3 of this campaign we opened up WAVE 2 and put in a larger order with the factory so you can still get in on this project!
 Direct delivery to your door! Yes, direct shipping to many countries that previously could only dream of Crokinole! Yes shipping will be expensive, but for the first time ever, almost anyone can back!
 Exclusive features! With four pads on the bottom of the board, recessed screws to protect your table and inset eyelets for easy hanging, plus a scoring track built right into the disc storage box, this is one well thought-out board! Your board will be 30.25 inches in diameter by 3" thick and comes in a double-boxed box that is 34.5 X 34.5 X 4 Inches and weighs in at 17.4 pounds! Yes this is a very solid board!
 New Innovations!  We are bringing back our hinge-less scoring box with scoring track printed right on the board, first introduced in late 2019! This means you can store your discs right in the scoring box that is newly designed with the players in mind, no more worrying about weak or broken hinges, and scoring is easier than ever!
 Huge Savings! Most high-quality boards will set you back $300 or more, but our goal is to offer a high-quality board to you at 1/3 the price! This board will retail for $180 or more but you are getting it for just $99! Go search for a high-quality board, they can cost $300 or more! You are getting some amazing features in a very well thought out board at a fraction of the cost! This may well be the last time we offer a crokinole board for this price.
 Acrylic 20s Holder X 2 included! Yes, for the FIRST TIME EVER we are including these brilliant acrylic 20s holders that you can put right on the edge of your board to keep track of your 20 point shots!  These retail for $20 per set of two but you are getting them FREE in your shipment!
Note these acrylic 20-holders are great for any tournament sized crokinole board including other brands.  They latch right onto the board and are a great addition to any game!


" I have to say they did a wonderful thing creating a decent board for under 100 bucks. ...I have enjoyed my Mayday board since 2012. I thought I'd have a "real" board by now, but it's hard to justify the cost when my Mayday board is so much fun. " - Greg Clensy, Glenbrook Nevada (BGG User Quoted HERE)
 High Quality! We have searched high and low and finally found the right factory for the job! Anywhere else just doesn't support the quality we expect in our products.
What is Crokinole?
This game is like shuffleboard in the round. If you are into board games perhaps you've heard of this elusive game, it is ranked #68 out of more than 60,000 ranked board games on BoardGameGeek and #5 in Family Games! Yes it is that good. We won't bore you with the endless reviews, just check them out for yourself at BoardGameGeek, this is one game that lives up to the hype! How to Play and Review of our very first board by Tom Vasel:
 Download the rules HERE .
"Well, if one isn't sure that a Crokinole board is part of one's future, it does make sense to spend a bit less, just to test the waters. And that's what I did by getting the 2018 version of the Mayday board. It's about $150 worth of quality for a $99 board. As someone who's not sure if this will be a "lifelong" game, then paying $99 for a $150 board just to "test the waters" is one hell of a deal. " Barry Miller, St Charles, MO, USA (BGG User Quoted HERE)
Why Our Board?
Sure you can buy a $200-$300 board out there, but maybe your significant other would kill you. Don't buy a board just to have to buy a casket that costs even more. Save yourself all that trouble and get a practical board.
"High-quality boards at 1/3 the price!"
After more than three years of searching we finally found a factory we can trust to deliver the best generation of Crokinole boards yet, and at an unbelievable cost! Our 2020 edition promises to be our best ever! Bower's Game Corner did an unboxing video of our 2016 board, check it out at the top of this KS page.
Technical Specifications:
Full specs HERE.
Boards:
The boards consist of a 26" diameter playing surface + 2 inch ditch + 1/4 inch rim = 30.50 inches in total diameter and 3 inches thick. The game will come double boxed in a box with dimensions of 34.5 X 34.5 X 4.5 Inches and weights in at a massive 17.4 pounds (7.9 KG). Yes these are HUGE! Our boards meet the The World Crokinole Championship™ specifications which are:
26" diameter playing surface (66cm)
distance from 'dead' center of the '20' hole to the pin/post circle is 4" (102mm)
distance from pin/post circle to 10/5 circle is 4" (102mm)
distance from 10/5 circle to 5/start circle is 4" (102mm)
distance from 5/start circle to the edge of the playing surface is 1" (25.5mm)
These equidistant factors contribute to the 'science,' design, and original intent of the game. "20" hole diameter is generally 1-3/8" (35mm) with a depth of ¼" (6mm) width of dividing circle lines is recommended as 1/16" (1.5mm) but no more than1/8" (3mm) width of ditch/gutter (from side rail/rim to edge of playing surface) is a minimum 2" (51mm).   This standard is neither new nor something defined solely for the WCC event. Rather, this is the paradigm viewed from dimensions established more than 120 years ago.
Our boards are made of MDF base with a real hardwood veneer on the top.  Yes it is real hardwood and not some cheap synthetic veneer (sticker).   Note we did have a problem with our 2011 boards coming as a synthetic veneer when they were advertised as hardwood veneer, but that was many generations back and this will be our 4th and 5th production run with this factory, so you can buy with confidence!
Not sold on MDF?  Have a look at a $300 Tracey's board HERE.  Looks amazing right?  Zoom in and look at the board, it is also MDF.  There is nothing wrong with MDF and plenty of  "high end" boards are also made of MDF.  No one makes boards out of solid hardwood, it is all either MDF or plywood.
Tracey Board -Extreme Close Up! Yep, $300 Boards are also made with MDF.
Discs:
International standard disc size has been set at 32mm diameter x 10mm thick ± .5 mm. There is no standard on discs being flat or convex/concave.  Our discs will all be flat/standard version.  In fact, the 3-time Crokinole World Champion said this about discs:
"...The bottom line is that the WCC Committee has never set a standard for flat vs C/C discs. We just get the best quality we can and no one up til now has requested one or the other. Personally, I've won the WCC adult singles 3 times and it's not something I ever concern myself with, i.e. whether I'm shooting with flat, convex or concave side down. I just make sure the disc is smooth in surface, especially for open 20 shots." -Brian Cook as quoted HERE. 
Note:  Per the main video (at 0:28 seconds) convex/concave discs are mentioned.  International standard disc size has been set at 32mm diameter x 10mm thick ± .5 mm. There is no standard on discs being flat or convex/concave.  Our discs will all be flat/standard version.  We are sorry for the confusion but we cannot edit the video once it is up without cancelling the whole project.  See more information in the technical specifications below.  These are exactly the same as our last 3 production runs from 2018 and 2019.
More Reviews
"I am happy with it. My kids bring friends over to play. They are less than nice to our board. It is now my beater to have kicking around or camping. ...Thanks Mayday for introducing me and my family to an awesome game. " -BGG User DB (quoted HERE)
"I'm a crokinole addict and have a great board, but that Mayday plays fine to me, for a general audience. Have a lot of fun with it, and if in the future you want to enjoy the hobby more you can savor shopping around for a great board.  The Mayday board.... does the job fine. " -Jay M, Greenville SC (BGG User Quoted HERE)
"Mine arrived this morning (USA East) and overall is in excellent condition. Outer ring is secure, board is nice and flat, surface is nice and smooth, and all but one peg fits snugly. " -Remo Williams, Vermont, USA (BGG User Quoted HERE)
"I love love love my Mayday board and I play it at least once a week since I bought it nearly a year ago. Shuffle board wax is like a fine sand. It’s fast and awesome. Enjoy!!"  -Mark Hasley, Toledo, OH, USA (BGG User Quoted HERE)
"My Mayday board is currently permanently set up at work and gets at least 10 games a day, it's a huge hit in the office. Planning to get a Willard Pro when I can afford it to replace the Mayday. Edit: we've figured out we've played over 5000 games of this at work, and I've personally played over 2000 games. The game also has incredible depth, and that depth reveals itself as you get better at it. "  -Beefstack, Canberra, Australia (Quoted HERE)
 "I am completely pleased with my Mayday board from the Summer 2019 Kickstarter.  That does not mean it is perfect but it is well worth the money I paid and the enjoyment I get from it.  My board is at my office where we have either one on one or team games every day at lunch, and occasionally after work is done.  I then put it in the very nice carrying bag I bought from Mayday to bring it home for games over the weekend.  It gets used CONSTANTLY and everybody enjoys it."  -Kenneth Harkin (see review in comments HERE)
"This is a very beautiful board from MayDay Games.I don't get to play it much due to it is considered a "fun or filler game" now by most of my group. With it being such a table hog and a whole process of getting it out and putting it away." -Greenosaur, BGG HERE
"Just got my Mayday board in and love it!" February 2020, -MrMatthew, BGG HERE
For a great candid discussion of these boards from this factory check this BGG thread with lots of actual customers HERE.
Add-Ons
All add-ons will be handled post-campaign, don't add anything to your pledges for now, but know that we will be offering several amazing add-ons including our very-popular carrying cases and discs in 9 colors.
These retail for $50 each, we will offer them as an add-on post-campaign. Many colors will be available to USA/Canadian backers only.
14 disc packs retail for $7.95, we will offer them to backers post-campaign in various colors. Note the game comes with 14 discs each of Black and Natural already. Many colors will be available for USA/Canadian backers only!
Shipping & Fulfillment:
The board will come double boxed in a 34.5 X 34.5 X 4 inch box weighing 17 pounds. There is now a $12 surcharge on all packages of this size due to Fedex/UPS dimensional pricing that has recently been being charged w/in the lower 48 USA states so shipping is just $28 + the $12 surcharge = $40. We are subsidizing the actual shipping cost for this campaign.
Sorry, these boards are TOO BIG for USPS to accept so we cannot ship to APO/AE at all. We can only ship UPS in fact so if you live outside the "lower 48" then we cannot ship you a board unless you are willing to pay the EXTRA shipping over the $40 we are charging.  We can ship to you in Hawaii sure, but you will probably need to pay around $75 shipping, or whatever UPS quotes us.  Buyers in Hawaii, Alaska, Guam, Puerto Rico, US Virgin Islands and elsewhere not LOWER 48, you have been warned!
For Australia, New Zealand, Japan, Canada and the EU (including the UK), we are finally offering to ship from within your own region for duty-free delivery right to your door. Note the shipping for any of these regions is $60 and will also be collected post-campaign during our Crowdox survey. (New Zealand will have an extra $10 surcharge for a total of $70.) Note, anyone from these regions (except Canada) will NOT be able to add on additional accessories post-campaign as the logistics of adding on carrying cases and more is just too complicated at this point.  
All other countries, if you really want a board then you need to find a freight forwarding service to ship it from a USA address to you in your country.  You will pay the usual $40 to ship it to any address in the USA and you will have to pick up the costs from there to your home.  There are many such services such as ShipItTo.com or Viabox or others HERE.
For just acrylic 20s holder backers, you are getting 2 of the holders and shipping is $4 w/in the USA or China/HK and $8 worldwide.  You will pay for shipping during the post-campaign survey on CrowdOx.

This project doesn't have any risks to speak of if we meet our goal. The factory is ready to print and the layout has been completed. Any additionally needed changes should be completed prior to the end of the campaign. We have launched 50+ prior Kickstarter projects. .

updates.update_content:
Damaged/Broken Boards & Discs
Hello to all you backers!  While we know most of you are very happy with your boards, it feels like that is not the case.  We had 3500 backers on this project and have reports of about 100 damaged/broken boards and about the same in terms of the discs being slightly not-circular.  Please any of you with issues remember to email to support@maydaygames.com and Curt can help you.  Less than 1/3 of 1% with issues sounds great unless you are one of the unlucky few.  We are striving to make everything right but it will be a while yet before we send all the replacements and reimburse everyone.  Curt is working hard on it but this project just has a lot of moving parts and it has taken Curt a while to get through everything.  We are sorry again for those of you who are less than happy with your boards.   So what can be done?
Gliss Powder

This is news mainly for our US and Canadian backers...
The Final Container Arrived!
It took around 3 months from the time it left the factory to get to our warehouse. (That may be a new SLOW record for receiving a shipment.) Oh well... there's nothing we can do to change it, so we might as well sit back and practice mindfulness with our Calm apps, imagining happily sliding discs across hardwood, dropping peacefully into that beloved center hole.

updates.update_userinfo: USA Boards are (almost all) delivered & sharing the Crokinole Love!
updates.update_content:
Fulfillment
So Dave has been doing amazing updating all of you on fulfillment but I just wanted to step in and follow up on this beautiful Friday afternoon here in Utah.  As he said almost all our boards for USA backers have now been shipped, we are JUST waiting on the last shipment of boards and accessories to arrive so we can ship the last few boards.  Anyone who is in the USA and ordered an EXTRA scoring track box (with or without discs), we are still waiting on those to show up in the last shipment to be able to fulfill your rewards.  This also means CANADIAN orders are still on hold as we need to get those scoring tracks in to ship the entire shipment of boards up to Canada for fulfillment.  Anyone who is in the USA that did NOT add on an extra scoring track/box and hasn't seen an email from us with a UPS tracking number that means one of 3 things:

Before the good news...
Git 'R Done!
If you haven't completed your pledge, please do so soon. The final container is through Customs and on its way to our warehouse. We will be shutting down the campaign around the end of March. Anyone who has not completed the pledge manager by that time will have their pledge treated as a contribution. Crokinole boards take up a lot of space and we can't store them forever.
Where Things Stand by Distribution Point

I love seeing the posts that people are receiving their boards. After months of battling the shipping industry, things are finally coming together. (I say "battling" but all I can really do is wring my hands and beg. We are at their mercy.)
I'll say this first in case you get tired of reading my blather before the end. When you receive your board, if there are any manufacturing defects that hinder the play of the game, please email our Customer Support staff at kickstarter@maydaygames.com. They are amazingly patient and will work with you to make things right. The same goes if the board gets damaged in shipping. Take pictures of the destroyed packaging and work with them to get a refund from the shipping company as everything is shipped with insurance. I've shipped additional boards to each of the distributors to cover the periodic problem that occurs. From past experience, this happens to approximately 2% of the shipments.

I hope everyone has had a very happy few days of the New Year and had plenty of time with family during the holidays. Here is where everything is with regards to the current shipping saga.
Europe (Except UK/NO)
90% of these boards have gone out and many received by backers right before Christmas. Ireland appears to be the exception. The boards were shipped and then everything crossing the Channel got shut down due to the new COVID-19 strain and were returned to the distributor. This shipping quarantine is expected to be lifted by the end of this week and they will be sent a second time.

Japan
For some reason, most of the Japanese orders got the weight of the boards messed up leaving the warehouse, so they got returned to the warehouse. They are now reshipped and on their way. Click here to see the the updated tracking numbers referenced by your Crowd Ox order number.
Korea

We now have two options for Crokinole gift cards.
Elf-referencing Christmas card
Seasons Greetings card
Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays!

Merry Christmas... Kind Of...
I've been putting off sending this update in the hope that I would be able to provide some positive shipping news. We really feel bad that the shipping hasn't worked out to get these boards to you in a timely manner. Never in the history of our company has it taken 2 months to get a container on a ship. We started attempting to get these shipped the middle of October and are just barely getting the last container on a boat bound for the US.

To Our Wonderful Asian Backers

campaign.story:
The dreaded Black Death has descended upon the town of Bristol. You are racing down the streets, desperate to escape into the safety of the countryside. If your cart is the first out of town you and your cart-mates win! Or do you? Some villagers on your cart may secretly already have the plague. If you leave town with a plagued villager on your cart, you will catch the plague and lose! What will you do to make sure that doesn’t happen? And who will you trust (or betray) along the way? 
Bristol 1350 is a social deduction and light strategy game for 1-9 players. Learn in 10 minutes and play in 20-40 minutes.
 Thank you to all of our backers for an incredible campaign!
If you missed the campaign you can make a late pledge here until fall 2020.
Backers can view project updates for information about delivery and add-ons.
Please visit our website or Facebook for the latest information on Bristol 1350.
We are excited to offer a Deluxe edition of the game! Depending on later demand, this Deluxe edition may be exclusive to Kickstarter, and at most it will be in rare distribution or only available at conventions. Beyond the core Standard edition of the game (+9 extra Kickstarter characters + stretch goals) the Deluxe edition includes: 
The 6 Deluxe coins to scale.
Every Kickstarter backer of Bristol 1350 (Standard or Deluxe) will receive 9 extra character cards in a special foil pack to add to their core copy of the game (for 18 total characters!) These characters will not be available after Kickstarter and are our way of saying thank you. We will reveal a new character every few days in the section below!    


We have upgraded every single component in the game with the space available in the box. Each upgrade represents our dedication to making high-quality and high-performing games at an affordable price. While we hope to include most of the upgrades listed above in future editions, they are only guaranteed for this first Kickstarter Standard and Deluxe printing of the game.   
The level of textural detail on the book, front and back, is kind of mouthwatering.
Bristol 1350 is a social deduction (lying & backstabbing) and light strategy game for 1-9 players. Learn in 10 minutes and play in 20-40 minutes. The game is enjoyable at all player counts, with lower counts leaning towards strategy and higher counts leaning towards social deduction, lying, and trust.
In the game each player begins in one of the three carts behind the starting line. Your goal is to be on the first cart to escape from the town. However, if anyone on your cart has the plague when you finish, everyone on that cart dies of the plague! Play continues until an all-healthy cart crosses or until everyone has the plague.   
You can view the full rules and print and play at this link. Note that the rulebook design is still underway, and if you want to play the print and play you'll need to construct your own dice and carts.
You can play for free online with Tabletop Simulator or with Tabletopia. 
As they become available, translations of the rulebook will be available on our website. We currently have translations available in French, German, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, and Greek. 
Some of the intriguing mechanics are discussed by The Board Game Critic in this video. 
A full playthrough of a 5-player game can be seen at this link. 
A full playthrough of a 1-player game can be seen at this link. 
Bristol 1350 is Volume 4 in the Dark Cities Series! Each Volume is a stand-alone game that comes in the same sized faux book box, focuses on a particular city and year, and includes a dark or mysterious element in its game play. Each game accommodates at least 2-9 players. 
Games in the Dark Cities Series have already sold over 150,000 copies and are now played around the world! We're already hard at work on Volume 5, and we will continue expanding the series. We know your game closet is a mess. Start your bookshelf collection of games with the Dark Cities Series! Each of these games is available in certain reward levels and as add-ons.
You can add an unlimited number of copies of any games in the Dark Cities Series to your pledge! Just add the amounts listed above and after the campaign you'll select which extra games you'd like to be added to your order based on how much extra money you pledged. If you have any questions, please see the FAQ section, post a comment, or shoot us a message. 
Your shipping cost does not increase for add-ons regardless of your location or the amount of extra games you order. You will receive all add-on games at the same time that all of the Kickstarter rewards are received (estimated delivery April 2021).  
The 18 original character paintings by Sarah Keele are available to purchase! The paintings are 8 x 10 inches and made with mixed media acrylic on masonite board. You can see some of the intricate details below. Email sarahmkeele@gmail.com for more details or to check availability of a specific character.    
Though this is not an add-on you can get through the campaign, the people at Next Level Board Gaming are selling 3D-printer files so that you can create an EPIC 3D version of the Bristol 1350 board that you can use with your copy of the game. You can see more details by clicking the picture below.
Regardless of order size or add-ons, shipping costs are $6 USA, $8 UK/EU, $10 Australia/Canada, $12 for the rest of the world. We work hard to find the best shipping rates out there, and we subsidize some of the shipping costs so that you don't have to pay as much. 
To avoid extra VAT or customs fees, games will ship to depots around the world (USA, UK, EU, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong) before being shipped to you. For non-depot countries, in most cases there will not be extra VAT costs because the price of our games is low enough to avoid the duties threshold.
If your order is lost or returned due to unforeseen circumstances, we will attempt to reship your game one time, free of charge. If you provided incorrect shipping information, you will be responsible for the reshipment fee. Due to unreliable mail systems, we will not perform reshipments destined for Brazil, Ukraine, Russia, or South Africa. 
These days there are many projects that wait to charge shipping until AFTER the campaign ends in order to shift the risk from the creators to the backers. We have "done our homework" in regards to shipping costs and are prepared to take on unexpected risk. What you pay now for shipping is ALL that you will pay for this reward.
DISCOUNTED PRICE | Normal MSRP of the Standard Edition will be $25. If we release the Deluxe Edition to the public it will be at least $45. We also offer the best shipping prices we can during the Kickstarter campaign.
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE CARDS | The 9 Kickstarter Exclusive character cards (for a total of 18 characters in your game) will never be available again and will be unavailable to the public. Additionally, campaign stretch goals, as well as the Deluxe version, are only guaranteed through Kickstarter.
EARLY ACCESS | Receive and play the game before anyone else in the world. 
JOIN OUR TEAM | Get first-in-line knowledge and insight into the project, and a direct line of communication to us as the creators. We will take your feedback into account before launching production.
We fell in love with the Kickstarter community when we launched our first game, Salem, back in 2015. Those backers are the ones that allowed us to quit our day jobs and make games full time. We've had more great experiences with the launch of Tortuga 1667 and Deadwood 1876. The feedback, support, trust, and positivity from the community is incredible. We consider each Kickstarter backer to be a close ally in our game-making endeavors and we'll do everything we can to protect your trust in us.
Our thoughts are with those around the world suffering from Covid-19. We have been planning and preparing for this launch for over two years, but it has coincidentally lined up with the pandemic that our world now faces. We considered delaying the project but after a lot of thought and encouragement from our community we ultimately decided to launch. As with all our games, part of this game's purpose is to educate about the history of the world. Bristol 1350 explores the history of the worst pandemic our world has ever faced: the Black Death. The people of 1350 faced huge challenges, and today those challenges are perhaps more relatable than ever. We will be donating $3,000 from our own pockets to Action Against Hunger to assist in getting food and medicine for those most in need. (Per Kickstarter regulations, funds raised within Kickstarter will not be directly donated and have no effect on the donation amount).

campaign.story:
5 Stack is a chip stacking game with the perfect balance of strategy and chance. It is designed for 2-6 players and can be played by both young and old. Players score points by creating stacks of 5 or more chips by either moving chips on the board or rolling the dice to place new chips. 5 Stack is a relatively fast-paced game and rounds can be as fast as 3-4 minutes for the speed demons and 20 or more minutes for those that like to chat and "cut up" while playing board games.
5 Stack is a captivatingly simple to play board game. When we developed the concept for 5 Stack, I wanted to create a board game that was simple enough for our daughters to play and understand but also interesting enough that I could invite adult board game veterans over and still have a blast. 5 Stack achieves both perfectly.
At 5 Stack's core, lies a straightforward but interesting game mechanic that contains the perfect balance of strategy and chance. The strategy element creates a meaningful game-play for those that like to dive deep into a game and try to outsmart their opponents. There is also enough chance to make the game exciting and surprising, allowing for some unexpected twists and turns. This combination means winning can be up for grabs for even the "I never play board games" person.
Whether you are young or old, new to board games or a seasoned vet, you will have a blast playing 5 Stack.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With any Kickstarter project, there are always risks and challenges, especially because the final product has not been produced yet. This will be my 25th Kickstarter project, and I will do my best to be completely transparent about any aspect of the project. I have done my very best to represent the final product as accurately as possible but there is always a chance that the final product might vary slightly or substantially based on unforeseen production issues. While we do not foresee this happening, it is important to know this going into this project.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14-day close of the campaign may be processed via Paypal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

We will be using a post Kickstarter pledge management service called Backerkit. If you do not log in to Backerkit and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8-week window has elapsed. Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics and lead to project delays. For this project we do not intend to allow this to happen, which may mean if you confirm your pledge too late, exclusive items may not be produced in sufficient quantity for your pledge.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.

Hoist your sails, watch for sea monsters, and mind those tricky tides as you travel from island to island, collecting and delivering goods to earn the most gold. Take command of a merchant ship as you manage both your hand of navigation cards and your ship’s cargo hold while charting the best course on the map!
Tricky Tides is a pick-up-and-deliver game that uniquely employs trick taking to determine turn order and the direction players can move their ships. This nautical-themed fusion of game mechanics is sure to bring something new to your game table.
We've met our funding goal, so you can expect a complete game with high quality components. We also have several stretch goals on the horizon that will allow for upgrades to premium components.

Origins
Wheeewwww!!! I'm just now recovered from an absolutely tiring (but also very exciting!) appearance at Origins Game Fair in Columbus, Ohio.  I had the honor of sharing a booth with Chad from 25th Century Games. We both had games that appeared on SEVERAL "Top 10 Most Anticipated Games for Origins" lists, so we had a steady stream of folks in our booth the whole show. It was busy!

Ahoy backers!
Tricky Tides is officially ready to send out. Quartermaster will start shipping your games out next week.
I had Quartermaster send me a copy ahead of fulfilling your games so that I could make sure they were packing them well and that they would arrive undamaged. They did an awesome job.

Ahoy there backers!
Good news! Tricky Tides made it on the boat before Chinese New Year. Whew! It's always a bit of a dice roll around early February in regards to what ends up shipping out, and what ends up sitting on the factory floor for an extra month. But we made it!
Your games are aboard the Clementine Maersk, a ship capable of holding 110,000 metric tons (242.5M pounds) of cargo. That's a big boat! You can follow along with the Clementine's voyage .

Ahoy there backers!
Sadly, I have to give you the dreaded "your Kickstarter is going to be later than originally anticipated" update. This is one of the most difficult parts of the process to predict properly, which is probably why Kickstarter defaults to saying "Estimated Delivery" when building a project page.
Despite production being in full swing two weeks ago, the factory informs me that they don't expect to complete manufacturing until approximately January 20. There's a lot of work that goes into making these games great!

Ahoy backers!

Not a ton of info for this update, just some cool pictures that I got last night at 4am. Production for Tricky Tides is underway!
In the interest of transparency, I do want to let you all know that the deluxe laser pieces are progressing a bit slower than I'd like. My intention was to make them all myself, but today I went out and recruited some help, so we should be able to get back on track.

Ahoy backers!

So let's get you an update about where we are at with the project now that the dust has settled from the actual campaign.

campaign.story:
When we started Restoration Games, we asked you to tell us which games to bring back. The number one request, by far, was Fireball Island. After more than a year of hard work, we are thrilled to announce: Fireball Island is back!
If this is your first time checking out the campaign, good to see you! You'll be thrilled to know that our amazing backers have already unlocked tons of stretch goals (and more still to come). As you check out the page, keep in mind that your pledge will also include all of this amazing stuff.
On the other hand, if you know you want it all and you want it now, we've got you covered.
So what are you waiting for? Come on and join the fun!
Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar improves on the art, components, and game play of the original. If you loved the game as a child, you'll see we turned that "delightful chaos" up to the max. If you never played it before, you'll appreciate it as a fun, exciting game for kids, families, and gamers alike.
We found a way to make the new island bigger, taller, faster, and cooler -- all while fitting in a smaller box.
Tom Vasel and the Dice Tower crew sat down with Justin Jacobson, the president of Restoration Games for a full, live playthrough of the base game, which should give you a good idea of how the game plays.
Sometimes, you may face Vul-Kar the way you want...
... but even then you can't be sure which way it will come out.
Even as the marble careens down the mountain, the paths and trees can divert it one way or another.
A tree might even save your life.
While the fireballs are unpredictable, we made sure that players have more control over their actions and more meaningful choices.
On your turn, play one of your two action cards to move your pawn and perform a special action.
Grab a snapshot from each part of the island and get back to the helipad.
Earn points for collecting sets of treasure.
If you get knocked down, you'll lose a treasure but gain a useful souvenir.
If you draw a Cataclysm, Vul-Kar gets to take a turn.
In all, the game remains fast, fun, and light, but offers meaningful choices.
We've also made arrangements with Rodney Smith of Watch It Played! to do a rules video at the time of release. 
NOTE: The board in the images above is a hand-painted prototype and does not reflect final art for the island. Here is the near-final art for the island and some renders showing off the detail that will show up on the finished board.
Blades of grass and cracked stones ease your path.
A lonely crab woos visitors at Skeleton Head Beach.
There are four expansions available in this campaign, and they are fully interchangeable with the base game and each other. We've also added some amazing new components, through hitting stretch goals, with no additional charge to backers.
                                                                                                                                                                                                       The view from the poop deck.
Hope you got that snapshot, Saul.
                                                                                                                                                                                        If this is your first Kickstarter, welcome! It's easy to get involved, and being a part of the community can be a lot of fun. All you have to do is:
Click on the pledge level you want to back.
Enter your email address and “Continue as guest”.
Enter your payment information.
Click the big green “Pledge” button 
To keep things simple, there are only two tiers for regular backers.
(You can order additional copies or optional buys by increasing your pledge amount. See Shipping and Fulfillment below for more details.)
For verified brick-and-mortar stores: We also have a special pledge level that is just for you. You pledge only $20 during the campaign. When we are ready to ship the games, after the campaign closes, you will use our pledge manager to finalize your order and pay the remaining balance due. If you have any question about your status, please message us, and we will confirm before pledging. All the terms and other information about this pledge level can be found in this special update.
We've blown through dozens of stretch goals, like a fireball through a rickety bridge, and unlocked tons of great additional content. Backers get the Treasure Trove expansion pack for free, and it's already full of new souvenirs, injury cards, and more.
Unlocked sleeves (optional buy, manually add $15 to your pledge).
Painted minis (optional buy, manually add $10 to your pledge).
Maker Kit (optional buy, manually add $40 to your pledge)
Not much time left to hit those stretch goals!
Given the unique design of the game, we only have one prototype and couldn't send out review copies. We wanted a fun way to let a bunch of people play the game, so we took the show on the road! J.R. Honeycutt, our Tinker-in-Chief, set off on a 30-day, 13-state road trip, including a stop in Canada! We met up with some of the most amazing game stores, cafes, conventions, and content creators to bring you a chance to play the game in person. And, of course, we got to meet our amazing fans and backers. It was truly a special happening. Below are some videos from the trip. (Note: These videos are of the hand-painted prototype board; the final version of the board will have printed art and won't be as shiny.)
One of our backers, MAJBrown22 was able to make it to the Secret Cabal Meetup at Beermongers and wrote up his impressions in this Board Game Geek forum post. 
Chris has apparently been ensorcelled by Vul-Kar.
 Check out some epic skill shots in this supercut:
PLAY

We are using key fulfillment partners within each shipping region. There are no additional customs fees, VAT, or similar charges.
There is only one shipping charge per region regardless of what reward you get -- we're subsidizing the rest.
For the US, Canada, and the EU, we are proud to partner with Quartermaster Logistics, the premier provider of Kickstarter fulfillment in the gaming industry. Your games will be safely packed by their professional team, and you’ll be emailed a tracking number when your package ships. For Australian backers, we'll be using Aetherworks, who we used on our Stop Thief! campaign and who did a great job.
If you would like to order a second copy, just increase your pledge amount by the cost of that pledge. You do not need to add anything for additional shipping. If you want more than two copies, add the shipping charge for each additional set of one or two. For example, if you wanted to get three copies of the base game sent to Canada, you would pledge a total of $220.
We are using BackerKit, a third-party service that lets us manage ordering and shipping. This service starts after the Kickstarter campaign is over. You'll have the chance add items to your pledge at that time. Importantly, though, there will be no additional fees due after the campaign. When you pledge, it will automatically calculate and add all shipping charges. The only additional charge is if you decide to get more stuff. Both pledge levels will be available in BackerKit. You can back the campaign now at any amount and choose your pledge later, or you can back at the Feel the Burn level and upgrade to the Full Vul-Kar.
IMPORTANT NOTE: Due to the limitations of our license, we are only able to offer the game in English and in the US, Canada, EU, and Australia. Please see the FAQ for more information.
As we head into the final hours of this campaign, every point of contact and bit of buzz can help. Send the message out far and wide on social media. Use these social media avatars to show your love for the game. And, remember, sometimes the best way is a direct, personal email to that one person you just know will get a kick out of it. Every little bit helps.
Restoration Games was founded by Justin D. Jacobson and Rob Daviau on a shared love of all those great board games they played when they were kids. We knew there were a lot of great treasures hidden beneath the sands of time. When we announced our plans, the response was overwhelming. We are dedicated to restoring these games to their rightful glory, bringing the fun to those with fond memories, and publishing great games for demanding gamers.
We must acknowledge the rest of the team who put in an unblelievable effort to make this a reality. Jason Taylor is our Visual Restoration Wizard, who is the reason everything we do looks so good. Lindsay Daviau is our Production Superhero, who ensures the finished products look amazing. JR Honeycutt is our Tinker-in-Chief; he helps get a game from the idea to a finished design. Suzanne Sheldon, our Master-of-Fireworks, makes sure everyone knows what we're up to.
We had lots of talented help with the art and design of the game. George Doutsiopoulos did the fantastic cover illustrations for the base game and the three main expansions. Card art is by Victor Perez Corbella. David Kegg did the retro art that appears in various places in the game, branding, and this campaign. Jean-Louis Sirois helped with some extra foliage illustration you see on this page and on the gameboard. Additional thanks to Matijos Gebreselassie and Bill Tiller for early concept illustrations. 3D sculpting for the miniatures and island features is by Chad Hoverter. Noah Adelman of Game Trayz, LLC did the initial design work on the island trays. Design Innovation, Inc. finalized the island trays. The video work was done by Josh McDowell, and the voiceover was performed by Graham Rowat. Rulebook editing was done by the Meeple Lady. Our thanks to all of them for their unbelievable effort in bringing this project to fruition.
And, of course, we would be remiss not to mention the original masterminds behind the game, Bruce Lund and Chuck Kennedy.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter and fourth game overall. Our first Kickstarter, for Stop Thief! was, by all accounts, a huge success. We received many compliments on how we handled everything, making sure everyone got their games in a timely manner. We pride ourselves on our customer service. If something happens, we'll work hard to make it right.

That said, Fireball Island is a design project unlike any other, involving three-dimensional, mechanical, plastics. Rob, Jason, and Lindsay have decades of experience working at Hasbro on such products.

This is also a licensed product. However, Justin negotiated complete creative control in the licensing agreement. Therefore, no final approval is needed to move to production.

updates.update_content:
Sorry for the extended delay, folks, but we've just released the Fun Run mode in the app. You don't need to do anything special; just download the latest version of the app from your platform of choice and get playing.
The new mode introduces a real time element to the game, making it even more frantic. Once enabled, the app plays a soundtrack that randomly and periodically plays three different sounds. If a sound plays while it's your turn, you suffer the corresponding penalty. So you'll want to move as quickly as possible. Remember, finishing your turn also means resetting the marbles on the board, so a 4-fireball Cataclysm can be positively nerve-wracking. Even when you make it to the Hello-Copter, you'll still have to act quickly so you don't lose any treasures.

Just a quick update to let you all know that the app has been updated to include scoring for the Spider Springs expansion. Still working on the art assets for the Fun Run update, which should be soon.

updates.update_userinfo: Spider Springs (and More) at Gen Con
updates.update_content:
Hard to believe, but Gen Con is just around the corner. This is always a hectic and exciting time of the year. This year's Gen Con is shaping up to be a big one.
First things first, let's talk Fireball Island. We were able to demo the new expansion, Spider Springs, at Origins, and folks are going bananas over this one. We learned a lot developing the base game and the initial slate of expansions. We figured out which things work best and what people like the most. What's fun, and what's too fiddly. We've taken all of those lessons to heart in producing Spider Springs, and I think this is going to be a must-have expansion for die-hard FI fans. It adds a healthy dose of mayhem and whimsy while still fitting in seamlessly to the regular game. You can learn more about the expansion on its . (Our website is in the middle of a makeover.)

Hello, everybody! For those of you that don't subscribe to our newsletter -- shame on you! -- we just announced a Fireball Island Maker Kit contest. We know that some of you have been doing some cool things with the game, but we want to share these creations with everyone and have some fun. 
All you have to do to enter the contest is share an image of your Maker Kit creation on social media (twitter, facebook, and instagram are all fine) and tag Restoration Games with #MyFireballIsland.

Just a quick update to let everyone know that, at the request of some backers, we've made the .stl files of the player pawns available for download on our website. Or you can get them directly using this link.
These are for non-commercial use only, but they're a good way to 3D print a replacement pawn if one goes missing or breaks (or if you are always fighting over who gets to play Saul).

updates.update_userinfo: EmberCorp Team-Building Exercise AKA Cooperative Mode
updates.update_content:
If you want a change of pace, now you can work together to take on Vul-Kar. You can download the cooperative rules here:
Fireball Island Cooperative Rules
If you have questions about the rules, you'll probably do best posting them at Board Game Geek, where they'll also live on to help others with similar questions. But, of course, I am happy to answer questions here as well.

updates.update_userinfo: Let's Talk About Some Other Kickstarters
updates.update_content:
There are a couple of new Kickstarters out there that might be of interest to Fireball Island fans.
The Secret Cabal has launched their 2019 campaign. Yes, we have a promo card in there. Yes, you can only get it as part of their full promo pack, which is $50. Obviously, we fully support them. They are great content creators and supporters of the hobby. However, if you are not inclined to support them or don't have the means, we intentionally designed the card as an injury card, so it would not impact core play. I do want to be clear though: We do not have any of these cards ourselves, so we cannot offer to sell them directly. I know some folks are just anti-promo. But we know, for a fact, that these promo cards help content creators like the Secret Cabal to meet their costs, and we believe strongly that media voices such as theirs contribute to a strong and growing hobby.

updates.update_userinfo: Golden Geek Award Nominations - Spare a Vote?
updates.update_content:
Just a quick update. We're thrilled that Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar has been nominated for a Golden Geek Award in the categories of Family Game, Thematic Game, and Artwork and Presentation. If you're inclined, we'd really appreciate your vote, especially in the Family Game category.
Golden Geek Award Voting Page
Thanks!

Pardon the shortness of this update. I’m out in Reno, Nevada at the GAMA trade show, telling all the retailers about our great games. It’s also a popular time to announce new products. Yesterday, we announced Unmatched, a new take on Star Wars: Epic Duels. But we’re also announcing the next Expansion for Fireball Island: Spider Springs!
This new expansion is another island tray, like Crimson Cutlass, but it actually slots into the main island in one of the gaps between the side trays. You still get to it through the caves, but now it interacts with the main island. Specifically, a broken bridge connects them, with an ember marble on it. When a fireball hits it or when you launch it directly, it drops down into the new tray. At the base of the tray, is a spring-loaded web contains small plastic spiders. When the marble hits, the catch releases, launching the spiders into the air. In short, more mayhem.

campaign.story:
There’s gold in the Black Hills of South Dakota, and you’ve come to find (or steal) your share. You’re staying at one of the three major establishments in Deadwood where you and your associates are working together to steal some of the gold-filled safes floating around town. But you suspect that the “friends” you’re working with are secretly plotting to keep all the gold for themselves. Will you be ready to turn on them before they shoot you in the back?
Deadwood 1876 is a social deduction game where you'll work with teammates to find and collect gold. But in the end, the team with the most gold will have to fight each other to the death to determine the winner! Will you spend your turns helping your team find gold, or preparing to defeat your own teammates in the Final Showdown?
2-9 Players. 20-40 minutes. Ages 13+.
1 Magnetic book box
1 Faux leather pouch
1 Rulebook (includes character biographies and Deadwood history)
3 Wood carved platforms
9 Wood star pawns
10 Wood engraved dice
79 cards (9 Characters, 20 Safes, 50 Deadwood)
The game comes in a magnetically-closing faux book. Extra room is provided in the center section should you desire to sleeve the cards.
The wood establishment platforms conjure the look of an old western storefront. Since each platform is stained and laser cut, the wood grain and color will be slightly unique in each copy of the game. The platforms are laser cut in the negative space, so each letter and design comes outwards.
The ten wooden dice each use custom designs instead of standard dots. Each colored dice corresponds to a gun in the game and has different values depending on the gun. Each die is colored and engraved.
 Nine wooden stars act as the pawns in the game.
 The dice and stars come in a faux leather bag.
The 9 characters are based on people who actually lived in or visited Deadwood in 1876. Character biographies are included in the rule book. Each character card is colored on the front, and black and white on the back.
The 20 Safe cards are designed to look like genuine safes from the 1870's.
Each of the 50 Deadwood cards contains a gun on top and a special item on the bottom.
In Deadwood 1876 you’ll use cards from your hand to try to win Safes from other players. Safes contain Badges, Gold, or Showdown Guns. Near the end of the game, players with Badges get extra turns. After the final turn, the team with the most Gold will advance to the Final Showdown. There, teammates will have to fight each other to the death using Showdown Guns. The last person alive is the winner!
Note: The video above gives a brief overview of rules. Strategy tips, rule clarifications, advanced optional rules, card descriptions, and character biographies are all included in the game rule book. We currently have rules available to view in English, German, French, Italian, Spanish and Dutch on our website. You can also view the contents of this page in Chinese.
Valuable items are hidden behind each Safe. You won't know which Safes have been shuffled in, so every round will play out differently.
Each player always has 4 Deadwood cards in their hand. You'll get to play one card from your hand each turn, and then it will be replaced from the deck.
Each card can either be used as the gun listed on top, or the special item listed on the bottom. The Holster lets you help out teammates, the Stetson lets you view hidden Safes, the Horse lets you abandon your team for a different one, and the Duster lets you improve your hand of cards.
The more powerful guns, such as the Messenger, have higher values on its dice, whereas worse guns, such as the Pepperbox, have lower values and zeros on its dice.  For shootouts you'll need to manage your hand and decide when to use a powerful gun and when to gamble with your weaker guns.
Each player takes on the identity of one of nine people who actually roamed the streets of Deadwood.
A game in progress.
This game requires teamwork, but also actively punishes you if you play too nice. That balance makes every round insane. - Sam J.
Mix strategy with the best and the worst of the Wild West, and you get Deadwood. - Charlotte C.
The strategy never gets old and I consistently find myself playing with new options every single game. -Spencer H.
Backstabbing has never been so much fun. This game keeps you on your toes. It is not one you can play half-heartedly. -Abigail S.
The more I play Deadwood, the less likely I am to trust other players. When I trust them too much, they take my gold and shoot me with a gun they stole from me. I always regret it. -Patti S.
Intrigues of Deadwood 1876 video from Beasts of War.
A great game (in our opinion), needs three things: solid mechanics, an awesome theme, and beautiful design.
Mechanics
Deadwood is a balance between teamwork and selfishness. If a player uses all of their best Deadwood cards and Badges to hunt down Gold for their team, they’ll be defenseless to fight against their teammates in the Final Showdown. But if a player only goes after Showdown Guns and saves all of their best cards, their team might not have enough Gold to actually reach the Final Showdown. If someone on your team doesn’t seem to be pulling their weight, they’re probably plotting to use your Gold to reach the Final Showdown and then destroy you! There may come a point when you need to attack, mislead, frame, abandon, or banish your own teammates.
Theme
When we were searching for the city for the 3rd Volume in the Dark Cities Series, we fell in love with Deadwood almost immediately upon learning about it. Large deposits of gold were discovered in the Black Hills of South Dakota in late 1875. Word quickly spread about the gold and the town of Deadwood was born almost overnight in early 1876. It soon reached a population of 5,000 miners, gamblers, prostitutes, outlaws, and businessmen. Lawlessness was prevalent as people flocked to the town to find (or steal) their share of the gold. Deadwood quickly became an infamous western town where old west legends lived and died.
The book has a raised UV effect so that all designs and logos pop out from the cover and spine.
Design
The illustrations from Sarah Keele and graphic design from Holly Hancock take players into the world of the wild wild west! We used wood and leather textures with our components, old west Victorian charm with our book and character cards, and cards that look like antiqued metal Safes built by the "Facade Safe & Lock Co" similar to Safes from the time period. The goal of our design is to take you and your friends deep into the raucous, chaotic, exciting world of Deadwood, South Dakota in its prime. You can view time-lapse videos of Sarah illustrating Molly Johnson, Solomon Star, Seth Bullock, Kitty Leroy, and the Holster.
We've already made many "premium" choices for the game (wooden platforms instead of cardboard, faux leather bag instead of plastic, wooden star tokens instead of standard pawns, faux book instead of standard box, etc.), because we believe in publishing awesome games regardless of funding amounts. But if we reach the following milestones, we'll be able to make Deadwood 1876 even better!
Note: Some of these upgrades will be exclusive to the 1st Edition of Deadwood 1876. Backing on Kickstarter is the only way to guarantee that all upgrades listed above will be included in your copy of the game.
We've been working hard on logistics all year and for this campaign we're very pleased to offer free US shipping at all reward levels, and low international shipping rates. We are also using fulfillment companies around the world so that you won't be charged extra customs fees. If you are mistakenly charged customs fees when the games arrive, just let us know and we'll pay you back. (For EU backers, we will be shipping games from Germany so you won't have extra customs fees)
Because of cheaper shipping, we’re happy to be selling Deadwood 1876 at prices that are even cheaper than the early bird levels of our previous two Kickstarter projects!
Deadwood 1876 is Volume 3 in the Dark Cities Series! Each Volume is a stand-alone game that comes in the same sized faux book box, focuses on a particular city and year, and includes a dark or mysterious element in its game play. 
Volume 1: Tortuga 1667 (Published 2017 thanks to Kickstarter!). Click the links to view the original Kickstarter campaign or our website. Tortuga was recently nominated as the best party game of 2017 by Board Game Geek!
Volume 2: Salem 1692 (Published as "Salem" in 2015 thanks to Kickstarter! Second edition published as "Salem 1692" in 2017). Click the links to view the original Kickstarter campaign or our website.
Both of our released games have sold over 20,000 copies and are now played around the world! We're already hard at work on Volume 4, and we will continue expanding the series. We know your game closet is a mess. Start your bookshelf collection of games with the Dark Cities Series! See Add-Ons section below for details.
If your pledge includes at least one copy of Deadwood 1876 then you can add an unlimited amount of Tortuga 1667, Salem 1692, or extra copies of Deadwood 1876 to your pledge! campaign.story:
Intaglio
More than just a deck of playing cards.
Intaglio is a series of prints & playing cards derived from hand engraved copper printing plates printed in the traditional Intaglio style in a collaboration between Kings Wild Project and Thornwillow Press in New York. Intaglio printing for playing card art has not been used for centuries. Why has this art style been lost? For this art and printing style to come to life, several factors must exist and come together at the same time. One factor is the skill of the artist. Intaglio engraving takes years of patience and practice to become proficient in. Another factor is that the equipment is not readily available. And lastly, finding someone with the equipment plus the ability to print them at a high archival quality is near impossible. One can see why attempting a project like is a monumental task.
For me as an artist, the Intaglio project is a realization of a long dream of mine to create a deck of cards by hand engraving the artwork. Over the years I have designed things by hand drawing or digitally mimicking engraving, but this project is the next step for me as an artist. The reason for me embarking on this project are two-fold. One reason is that I have a passion for this beautiful art style. The other reason is that as an artist I love the challenge that this offer me to try to accomplish a project such as this.
An inspiration for this deck is one of the first decks that made me originally fall in love with playing card design. Titled the "New Era No. 46" and name such to symbolize a new era of beautiful playing card design heading into the 20th century. I have long wanted to use the New Era court set as inspiration and create my own "engraving" style versions of them, and I felt this was the project to do it. The interesting thing about the New Era No 46 deck is that it was published around the same time that the actual printing presses that will be used for the Intaglio project were created. For me, this project, in a way, is a new era. I am finally getting to pursue the art style of engraving to its physical form.
Thank you for visiting my project, and thank you for helping it become a reality and becoming a backer.
 Pledge Tiers
                                                            This project is a collaboration between Kings Wild Project and Thornwillow Press.
 Thornwillow's Story
The Kickstarter video was created by Six Foot Five Productions.
Important Notice: All Images are conceptual renderings and representations of what the intended final product is supposed to look like. We have done our best to represent our vision honestly and as close to final as possible. With a project of this nature please know that the final product and or designs may very than the images shown. If changes are made we will do our best to communicate those changes clearly.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks and challenges with any Kickstarter. This Kickstarter IS my biggest undertaking yet! There are so many moving parts and things that have to work together "just right" for this project to work. My past experiences with being a Kickstarter creator have taught many lessons. My pledge to you as a backer and supporter of this project is to be completely honest and completely transparent about the entire process. If there are speed bumps or hiccups (which there always are) I will do me very best to communicate with you what is going on and how I plan to resolve any issues. One of the most important parts of being a creator and or a backer is to be flexible, as this IS a creative process and you are traveling along with me for the ride. Thank you for your support!

Update: SOLID SILVER COINS are now unlocked!! See 'Add-ons' below.
 Select 24K Gold Plated coins now available! See 'Add-ons' below.
What are Hobo Coins?
Throughout time, people have modified coins by hand-carving or engraving their own designs into existing coins. But this form of folk art really took off during the Great Depression. Those that were out of work or down on their luck took to modifying coins by engraving their own designs into them. They would use pocket knives or even filed down nails to carve beautiful designs that were as varied as the artists themselves. Often, these coins would portray skeletons or skulls, incorporating elements from the coins as part of their final works of art. They would almost always keep the lettering on the coins.
The Hobo Coins project brings back this largely forgotten piece of American history. These coins are being minted by the oldest continuously operated private mint in the U.S. and are SOLID. They each weigh about the same as 5 US. quarters, and are a little larger than the size of a US Dollar coins (these coins are 39 mm). Die-struck with over 100 tons of pressure in solid metal alloys and featuring antique finishes. Please note that Hobo Coins are not actual US currency or modified US currency coins, they are die-struck new coins at different sizes, weights, and (clearly), different art than actual US coins.
Help revive a piece of history you can carry!
The Designs
Each coin was crafted and designed by me using some of the most iconic coins as their base:
The ‘R.I.P.’ - 1922 Peace Dollar
Arguably the most beautiful coin ever produced, the U.S. Peace Dollar was originally produced to commemorate the peace that followed World War One. My rendition features a skull portrait (keeping the radiant crown) on the front (obverse), and two skeletal hands breaking a rifle on the back (reverse). Interesting to note that the ‘broken rifle’ was abstracted into the Peace Symbol we know today. Rest in Peace! Aged with an antique silver-finish. As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 12 gauge coin. Also, this coin will have a 'reeded' edge like the original Peace Dollar.
The 'R.I.P. Dollar - actual coin finish may vary.
The ‘Bad Mojo’ - 1936 Buffalo Nickel
My take on the classic Buffalo Nickel hobo coin (popular because it was a ‘soft’ coin to carve), features a skeleton Chief with a no-nonsense attitude on the front, and an intricately carved buffalo skeleton on the back. Aged with an antique silver-finish. As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 12 gauge coin. This coin will have a 'flat' edge like the original Buffalo Nickel.
The 'Bad Mojo' - actual coin finish may vary.
The ‘Walking Reaper’ - 1936 Walking Liberty Half Dollar
Scares the sh*t outta me—and that’s a good thing! Based on what is considered one the most beautiful coins of all time, the Walking Liberty Half Dollar. Front side (obverse) features a grim reaper you never want to meet, and the back of the coin shows a Poe-esque scene with a raven. Nevermore! Aged with an antique silver-finish. As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 12 gauge coin. This coin will have a 'reeded' edge like the original Walking Liberty Half Dollar.
The 'Walking Reaper' - actual coin finish may vary.
The ‘Old Hobo’ - 1891 Morgan Dollar
Even hobos like a drink! The front face (obverse) of the coin features a hobo skeleton enjoying a pint. The back side (reverse) shows a skeleton hobo chilling in a box car with his loyal dog companion. Aged with an antique silver-finish. As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 12 gauge coin. This coin will have a 'reeded' edge like the original Morgan Dollar.
The 'Old Hobo' - actual coin finish may vary.
The ‘Hobo Coin / Hobo Signs’ Limited Edition Print
To compliment the coins, I’ve designed this print which features a hobo walking through a shanty town along railroad tracks carrying a gunny sack, and is emblazoned with 'Liberty' at the top. Each print is 18” x 24”, signed, and numbered.
'Liberty' - inspired by coin typography and hobo coin art, each 18" x 24" print will be signed and numbered.
Add-ons
Additional coins or posters can be added to any base pledge as needed. Simply click on ‘Manage My Pledge’ and manually increase your pledge amount by the following:
Coins - add $14 (in the US), 15$ (international) to your pledge amount per additional coin, feel free to add as many as you would like. After the project closes you’ll be able to specify which design(s) you’d like.
Limited Edition Prints - add $40 (in the US), $46 (international) to your pledge amount per print.
Solid Silver Coins - add $60 ($65 international) to your pledge amount per solid silver coin. These coins are one troy ounce of solid .999 fine silver and will come with a Certificate of Authenticity card that is signed and numbered. The final quantity will be determined by the number ordered, feel free to add as many as you'd like. 
To add items to your pledge: Manually increase your pledge amount by the cost of the add-on items. After the project closes, I'll send you a link to make your final selections. For now, just click "Manage My Pledge" and add on the amount of your coin or print add-ons.
Here's a quick video on how to do this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ak8SWlMeIoo&app=desktop
And here are some pictures of the coins:
One Troy Ounce Solid Fine Silver Coins (.999)
  Back of the solid silver RIP
  One Troy Ounce Solid Fine Silver Coins (.999)
  Back of the solid silver Bad Mojo
  One Troy Ounce Solid Fine Silver Coins (.999)
  Back of the solid silver Walking Reaper
  One Troy Ounce Solid Fine Silver Coins (.999)
  Back of the solid silver Old Hobo
Select 24K Gold Plated Coins add $25 ($30 international) to your pledge amount per selective plated coin. These coins are nickel silver coins that are selectively plated with 24K gold. Same size and weight as all the other coins; please note that the base coin is not solid silver but is actually a nickel silver alloy. 
              Four Coin Display - add $15 ($20 international) to your pledge amount per display (each display hold four coins). A great way to show off your coins! Comprised of 3 acrylic panes with embedded magnets, this is a simple, elegant, and easy to open and close system for displaying Hobo Coins. 
Acrylic Hobo Coin Display
  3 panel system with embedded magnets for easy opening and closing.
Stretch Goals
Funded to $10,000 - UNLOCKED!!!!
Antique Bronze versions of all coins. You can now select Antique Bronze coins for any of the coins you've backed for, or add these coins to your existing pledge. You'll be able to select which coin finish you want for all your coins after the project closes.
Antique Bronze Stretch Goal Coins
Funded to $15,000 - UNLOCKED!!!! 
Antique Solid Copper versions of all coins. You can now select Antique Copper coins for any of the coins you've backed for, or add these coins to your existing pledge. You'll be able to select which coin finish you want for all your coins after the project closes.
Antique Copper Stretch Goal Coins
Funded to $20,000 - UNLOCKED!!!! 
Antique Brass-Plated Steel (works with magnets! These are actually a shade thinner than the other coins - 10 gauge, that's the only option available from the mint). You can now select Brass-Plated Steel coins for any of the coins you've backed for, or add these coins to your existing pledge. You'll be able to select which coin finish you want for all your coins after the project closes.

campaign.story:
WELCOME TO TORTUGA!
The year is 1667 and you are a pirate sailing the waters of the Caribbean. A Spanish Galleon floats nearby, and you’ve talked your crewmates into working together to steal all of its treasure. What you haven’t told your fellow pirates is that you have no intentions on sharing the treasure once you have it. Your crewmates have told you that they share your loyalty and that they’ll help you maroon the greedy pirates on your ship to the rocky island of Tortuga. But you’ve seen your friends’ loaded pistols and heard their whisperings of a mutiny. You know that nobody can be trusted.
For 2-9 Players. 20-40 minutes. Ages 12+.
  GAME CONTENTS
1 Faux book container
1 Rulebook (includes character biographies)
64 Cards (9 Brethren of the Coast, 16 Event, 30 Vote, 9 Loyalty)
1 Rubber playing mat
1 Burlap pouch
9 Wooden pawns
8 Wooden treasure chests
THE GAME
The game is packaged in a faux book box. The box has 3 magnets to keep it closed when you're moving it to and from game night.
  The game fits nicely inside the faux book box. The box is big enough for cards to be sleeved, if desired.
  The game board is a rubber playmat. The board rolls up like a map.
  The 8 wooden treasure pieces come in a burlap bag.
  Each of the 9 wooden pawns matches with 1 of the 9 pirates you can be in the game. Each pirate is based on a real pirate who roamed Tortuga and the Caribbean seas in the year 1667.
     Each player has a secret loyalty: British, Dutch, or French. But be careful who you trust; someone claiming to share your loyalty may stab you in the back and steal your hard-earned treasure.
  Use Event cards during the game to help your team get treasure, or to maroon members of the opposite team to the island of Tortuga.
  Use Vote cards during the game to secretly impact Attacks against the Spanish, Mutinies against your Captain, and Brawls against your fellow pirates.
REWARDS
We're not big into confusing reward levels or expensive add-ons. We want each of our backers to get the best reward we can offer: this beautiful game! We splurged on a few items that we felt really added to the game quality (the rubber playmat, faux book, burlap bag, wooden treasures), while still keeping the overall costs low and eliminating unnecessary pieces. We're proud to give our Kickstarter backers the best price that this game will ever see.
$1-$9 Thank you for your support!
$10 An emailed PDF of the cards & board, ready for printing
$23 Tortuga 1667 
$44 Tortuga 1667 x2 
$63 Tortuga 1667 x3 
$80 Tortuga 1667 x4 
$100 "Make 100" Kickstarter special. Includes Tortuga 1667 x2, plus our illustrator will turn any person you'd like (perhaps you or a friend) into a pirate. We'll send you 2 custom "Brethren of the Coast" cards of this pirate that you can use interchangeably in the game. 
$150+ Tortuga 1667 x4 + Special Mention in the back of the rulebook + Print and Play version of the game. Thank you for your extra support! 
$175 Tortuga 1667 x10
$250 Retailer Discount: 20 Copies of the Game. You must message us with proof that you're an established retailer of some kind for this reward. (Only available in the US, UK, & EU)
Shipping: We are using fulfillment companies around the world to make shipping costs as cheap as possible for our backers. For our European and UK backers we will be shipping from within the EU so that you do not have to pay any customs charges. 
TESTIMONIALS
I don’t trust my friends anymore. But I love this game. -Tessa
Tortuga is a game full of surprises! Each round brings with it new and intriguing events that ultimately make you the master of the sea or scum of Tortuga. It all depends on how proficient you are at finding your team and making that knowledge count. -Alex R.
I have played this game basically every week for the last couple of months. I have loved it every single time and never been bored. It’s a great game to play with friends and really makes you think. -Abigail S
I love this game!!! No game is ever the same, and it's always exciting. You never know who is going to do what or if you are trusting the right person. Everyone I have introduced to this game has loved it too. -Alex W.
Tortuga is a great social deduction game and it looks great on your game shelf too! Love the game even though sometimes it makes me question my friends and family. -Brett A.
A game where I can deceive and be called Captain is a very good game indeed." -Derek H.
Tortuga is unique in the fact that it allows the perfect amount of deception for those that enjoy tricking and deceiving others, but it also provides the opportunity to work off of pure logic and reason for the other players that do not particularly excel in manipulation. I have had the opportunity of playing this game numerous times with many different crowds, and every game is completely different because of the different strategies and techniques that people can utilize. -Levi H.

If you have an article about Tortuga 1667 or this project, please message us so we can have it featured here. We're also happy to answer any questions you have for the articles. Thanks!
RULES OVERVIEW
PLAY

  Note: The video above gives a brief overview of the gameplay and rules. Complete rules, including tips & tricks, rule clarifications, advanced optional rules, event card descriptions, and character biographies are not shown in the video, but are all included in the game rulebook. If you'd like to look at the complete rules now please visit the links below:
