2nd Edition Limited Deck:
There will be 1,000 of the 2nd edition limited decks printed. It will come in a vintage recreation of the original box with the long tongue. It will be printed with A. Dougherty's famous Linoid Finish. It will be wrapped in a recreation of the original paper wrapper printed on archival paper and sealed with 2 restored stamps. Each limited deck will be signed and numbered on the deck and on the back of the paper wrapper.
A Brief History: Andrew Dougherty Playing Card Company 1848-1930.
Andrew Dougherty was a hard working Irish immigrant that used his own savings to start a small printing house and playing card manufacturing company. Although his cards were rough at first, his persistence and hard work led to his company becoming one of the most influential manufacturers of his time. 
 In 1872 he built a manufacturing plant located on Centre Street in New York, just a block away from the Brooklyn Bridge. With the new building Dougherty’s innovation shined through as he changed the playing card industry. His playing cards from the Centre St. factory had double heads and featured rounded corners. Both of these breakthroughs were advertised on the back of his famous eagle wrappers. 
 In 1876 Dougherty was awarded a U.S. Patent for his triplicate cards. The triplicate was a miniature card placed in the top left and bottom right corners. It was a revolution in the way cards could be held and viewed. The decorative ace of spades and the wrapper for the first No.18 Triplicate deck showed a fanned hand of cards with the triplicate miniature indices viewable on each card. The first deck of triplicate cards came with a best bower, which was later replaced by a joker. 
The only competition that Dougherty faced with the triplicates was the Squeezers cards from the New York Consolidated Card Co. The patent that the NYCCC acquired for the Squeezers cards was for the modern indices that we see now on all playing cards. 
Dougherty printed his triplicates until 1883 when he was issued another patent for his Indicator cards. Like the squeezers, the Indicators featured a number and letter indices printed outside the border. 
Andrew Dougherty passed away at the age of 78 in 1905. His sons ran his business for 2 years following his death and then sold the company to the United States Playing Card Company in 1907. The United States Playing Card Co. continued to run the A. Dougherty manufacturing company until 1930 when they merged it with the New York Consolidated Card Company, relabeling it the Consolidated-Dougherty Card Co. Inc. They ran Consolidated-Dougherty as a division of USPCC until 1962 when they retired the label, bringing all labels and decks under the USPCC umbrella. The most famous A. Dougherty deck Tally-Ho is still available today.

The Minimalist Deck: Helvetica is an ultra-modern deck of 56 playing cards printed on Bicycle paper by the US Playing Card Company. 
As a modern design junkie and typophile, I have never found a deck of cards that fit with my personal design aesthetic. I wanted something that felt simple yet lush, clean but purposeful. When I couldn't find it, I decided to create it. This is The Minimalist Deck.
As a designer, recreating something as classic and timeless as a deck of Bicycle playing cards is both an incredible challenge and extremely rewarding. I pondered multiple combinations of fonts and glyphs before ultimately deciding on this combination. Then I changed my mind. 
I went back and forth, switching between serif and sans-serif fonts, before finally giving in and designing not just this deck, but four decks of cards to make up The Minimalist Collection. Helvetica is the first in the series, and the goal of this Kickstarter is to produce 5000 decks. Once they are gone, they won't be recreated, and it's on to the next in the series.
Rewards
Each deck of Bicycle playing cards contains 56 cards: 52 playing cards, 2 Jokers, and 2 gaff or ad cards. 
$12 gets you a deck, as long as it's one of the first 250.
$15 gets you a deck as well, even if you aren't one of the first 250.
$20 gets you a deck of cards and a signed and numbered art print of the Ace of Spades. 
$25 gets you two decks. Poker is much faster with two decks. I'm just saying...
$30 gets you two decks, plus the signed and numbered art print of the Ace of Spades.
$35 gets you a deck and a t-shirt. The shirt is super soft.
$40 gets you three decks of cards. 
$45 gets you two decks and a t-shirt. Represent with pride!
$50 gets you one deck of cards and an uncut sheet of Helvetica: The MInimalist Deck, straight from the USPCC factory. There are only 50 of these, and they'll be hand-signed and numbered. This is probably the one my mom will buy.
$75 gets you six decks of cards. They make cool gifts for your friends.
$100 gets the art print of the Minimalist Deck, seen below. This measures 40" x 21" and all cards are printed to scale. These will only be printed for this run on Kickstarter, and never again. These will be signed and numbered, and a limited run of 25. You'll also get one deck to accompany the print.
$150 gets you a brick of cards (in layman's terms, this is 12 decks).
$500 puts your name on one of the gaff cards. There is only room for five names. You'll also get 12 decks. 
Where the Money Goes
The pledges from this project go towards printing and creating this one-of-a-kind deck of cards. The USPCC has all the files, everything has been approved, and they are ready to start printing. At this point, all we need is you to help make this happen.
The art print! Click here for a full resolution image.
Shipping
The goal is to have everything shipped out by May. I need about two months to get everything turned around. I also happen to be getting married in May, so there is a slim chance that the decks won't be shipped until June. It all depends on how the wedding planning is coming along. :)
 International Shipping
There are additional fees associated with each reward for international shipping. Please be sure to add these to your pledge if you live outside the USA.
Thank You
I honestly can't thank you enough, even for just reading to this point. Seeing a tangible item come to life from my design is an absolute dream come true. Thank you for your support and for helping to make this happen. 
Follow us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/minimalistdeck

Introduction
Hey Kickstarters!
My name is Jody and I am a Freelance Illustrator from Colorado. About 4 months ago, my wife and I, with our two kid moved in with my in-laws to start up my own Freelance Design company called Fluent, Inc. Since then, I've been looking for a great personal project.
The Hipster Playing Cards -Limited Edition
Will only be printed for Kickstarter Backers and will come with Hipster Quotes.
A mock up of the Tuck box
NEW! The Hipster Bicycle Playing Cards-Bicycle Edition 
Will be printed unlimited and will not come with Hipster Quotes.
A mock up of the Bicycle brand Tuck Box
The Inspiration
Where did the Hipster Deck come from?
The evolution of the Hipster deck was really a family process. As I mentioned in the video I was directed to Kickstarter I wanted to find a great project that would give me the chance to design something different than the usual products and logos I work on. My wife has a pretty good feel for things that are creative/new and came up with the idea to design a deck about hipsters. (My Three year old approved and showed her support by running around the house wearing plaid, and thick 3D glasses with the lenses knocked out.)
My Little Hipster-This is my daughter being herself
At first the deck was about the strong visuals that come to mind with hipsters; Buddy Holly rimmed glasses, epic mustaches, flannel shirts, bicycles… but the deck didn’t really come together until I thought about adding quotes to each card. It was the quotes that solidify the project in my mind as they helped capture the spirit of irony, wit, and deep thinking that typify the hipster culture.
As I spent time researching the look and feel of hipsters on Tumblr and Pinterest I found that there are different segments within the hipster trend, some that are apathetic and a tad angsty, but there is a good chunk of hipsters that really want to engage our world and it’s woes to make a mark. It’s the latter group that I hope to immortalize in this deck. The can do-ers that have a healthy sense of who they are and the humor in their own contradictions. 
When it comes down to it this deck was just fun to put together. I spent a lot of time laughing and seeing the delightful, and sometimes not so subtle, influences that hipsters have on all areas of pop culture. I hope that this deck will bring people together to not only play all types of games, but will get them talking and enjoying a deeper level of being together. (And by the way, my wife asked to waive her royalties in exchange for a LARGE Starbucks gift card… yep, we’re going to need a lot of backing to fund that one - so thanks in advance!)

This project is in NZ currency, but will be produced and shipped from the US. All prices are in NZ dollars including shipping rates. US dollar pledge amounts are a friendly guide only.
FINAL STRETCH GOAL - Q1 Quality ACHIEVED!
Where did today's standard card design originate?  That's the question I began to explore in depth many months ago.  One that put me on a journey to research and design a deck of cards inspired by beautiful historic art.
Playing cards have evolved over many hundreds of years, with the echoes of the pattern we know today forming around the 15th century in Rouen, France.  A design emerged that was adopted and copied in England, and then spread across the globe.
I've worked with card historians, museums and archives in my search for this original art.  My reference material includes pieces from the Bibliothèque nationale de France, British Museum, Archives Department of Seine-Maritime, and Fitzwilliam Museum of Cambridge. 
I'm passionate about the quality of the Origins. The goal for this campaign, with your support: to produce one of the highest quality decks made by the USPCC.  The embossing, hot stamped gold foil, Bee cards, and tuck stock are expensive but I've worked to keep pledge costs down.  A special deck to own, play, or gift.
It would really be an honour to have your support in making the Origins a reality.
You can also read a little more about myself and the project at Kardify here. And at Max Playing Cards here.
View an archive of the cards and their inspiration -here-
Bonus with every pledge!
As a sincere thank you, all pledges will receive a postcard displaying an historic original by Valery Faucil, late 15th century, on one side and the Origins compliment on the reverse.  All backers names will also be listed on the Origins website (with your approval). Your support is much appreciated! 
You can see more on how playing cards have evolved at the World of Playing Cards, Plain Backs and the International Playing Card Society.
These decks will be premium quality.
The tuck cases will be printed on highest quality card stock, Soft Touch Midnight Blue & Pearlesque Natural Pearl.
The decks will have a unique custom seal
Both cases will be fully embossed, and embellished with hot stamped gold foil.
All of the cards are individually researched and custom designed.
They will be printed on casino quality Bee stock with a magic finish.
And printed by the prestigious United States Playing Card Company at the highest quality control level, Q1
Concept render
The First Edition features a unique gold foil First Edition tuck box which will not be printed again.  The cards will feature a metallic ink colour scheme front and back.  There are no current plans for future editions.

The Grail deck will be limited to a maximum of 2500 decks and will not be printed again. The Grail cards will feature a subtly different silver accented metallic colour scheme to the First Edition. The tuck will be printed in gold foil on a special pearlesque stock.
The Grail is available for $17 NZ ($14.10 US).  It is available in a range of pledges.
                             The First Edition and Grail decks will share the same base art work using metallic inks, with subtle differences in color palettes.  The art in the cards will be refined through to deadline.
Brighter gold palette for the First Edition, deeper silver accent for the Grail
                                                                                               Working with magician Lee Asher, the deck will include a unique gaff card.  And with thanks to Lee, a special downloadable magic lesson using the Gaff will be available to all backers!  The backs feature an extended scroll for display in fans.
Add a few extras! 
Simply add your Add On totals to your pledge amount.  Then at the end of the campaign you'll be asked to confirm your selection.  Non-US backers, be sure to add the additional shipping charge.  
All prices are in NZ dollars including shipping rates.  US dollar amounts are a friendly guide only, rounded to the nearest 10c.  
Commemorative Box
The Commemoraive box will include both decks, signed, and a signed certificate. The decks are set in a foam inlay, and the lid is inlaid with the Collector's Coin. The wood is a Rimu veneer, native to New Zealand, and the box size will be approx 18cm x 13.5cm x 4cm (7in x 5.3in x 1.6in).
Card Clip
The clip is laser cut in black acrylic, and designed to slip snuggly around your Origins deck for protection and a little extra bling.

A soft cover art booklet - 26 pages, 25x18cm (9.8in x 6.8in). The booklet will include the Origins art, prints of historic originals and a little detail on the history of cards.  The booklet will include a foreword by card historian Ken Lodge.
                                                                         The 2" collector/dealer coin will be a two tone antique gold piece with a special engraved edge.
                                                                                             The Origins tees will be printed on high quality fitted Tultex men's and women's tees, in a luxury gold metallic foil, and deep blue ink.  They can be purchased in both dark coal and natural cream.
This 18" x 24" (42cm x 61cm) poster, printed in a gold metallic ink on your choice of black OR white art stock, will be signed and will ship from New Zealand.

campaign.story:
With the Kadar Deck, we have broken with tradition and produced a truly original deck of cards.   
We want our cards to look like nothing that you have seen before; this is a deck of cards that instantly stands out from the 'pack'.  
We draw inspiration from the diversity of design throughout the history of playing cards. From the colourful pictorial cards of the 18th Century and the cards carried across Europe by the travelling fortune tellers.  
Our cards look colourful and intriguing. The design of the cards reflects the strange fortune telling cabinets that lurk in the shadows of old amusement arcades, the vivid picture cards we collected as kids and the graphic style of 'Silver Age Comics'. Our cards look vibrant and entertaining, but also hint at a deeper meaning beneath the surface.
Who are these cards aimed at?  
The Card Collector. It is unlikely that you will have such a striking, original and unique deck of cards in your collection yet. Put the Kadar deck out on a table with a few other decks and see which one draws the eye.  
The Magician. As these are a full set of poker cards on the best Bicycle stock, you can use them to perform standard card magic. In addition, we show you how you can take your magic to the next level; investing a simple trick with meaning and a personal connection to your audience. 
The Social Animal. Our cards are aimed at simply making you the most interesting person in any group with something that will draw the eye and everyone's attention. We guarantee it! Also if you put a dime in the cabinets, the cards do something strange and mysterious; something that will draw a crowd of interested onlookers. 
We'd love it if you chose to back our Kickstarter project. When you do you will hold, in your hands, the most original and intriguing deck of cards you are ever likely to possess. 
READ MORE ABOUT THE MAGICIAN AND READERS PATH TIERS HERE
The Plan. 
We are asking for an absolute, minimum target sum to get these cards printed and distributed. In time there will also be a series of stretch goals to improve the quality of the whole experience and to offer you more fun stuff. At the start of the campaign, our focus is on the cards. However, stay tuned and see what other exciting ideas we have in store; there's certainly more to come.

campaign.story:
In case you're not keeping up with the latest foretellings of doom, check out the video to see how the Norse have predicted the world may perish and sprout anew (without us) beginning February 22nd. Assuming we're still here, though...
Norse mythology has long had a place in Western popular culture. From comic books to major motion pictures featuring gods such as Thor, Odin, Frigga, Sif and of course Loki from this deck. A quick search for "Norse mythology in popular culture" gets you to the Wikipedia entry for a big list of Viking characters in movies, manga and literature.
The star of the deck, Odin, is the main god of the Æsir, the pantheon of Norse gods. He exchanged an eye to be able to drink from the Well of Wisdom and was the god of battle, poetry, magic, and perhaps not surprisingly, wisdom. Two of his sons, Thor and Balder, are the King of Clubs and Hearts, respectively. The King of Diamonds is Njord, a member of the Vanir race, with whom the Æsir were at war. When they were negotiating a peace treaty, Njord was selected to join the Æsir in what amounted to a hostage exchange. The Queens of each suit are wives of that suit's King and all but one of the Jacks are sons of that suit's King. Since two of Odin's sons are Kings themselves, the Jack of Spades is represented by Odin's trusted ravens Hugin and Munin (Thought and Memory).
Deciding which gods to include in the deck involved studying works on Viking mythology and giving concepts and original research to my design partner to use in producing what I hope are interesting and desirable cards for the Kickstarter and collector communities!
The Suits
For each suit I chose the following color combinations for the court cards costumes based on their meanings in Norse mythology:
Spades- Black and Silver: Black is potential, the basis for all and the knowledge of hidden things. Silver expresses change and the quest for knowledge. The Spades court are powerful, wise and in pursuit of knowledge.
Hearts- Red and White: Red embodies magical and protective powers as well as vigor and aggression. A sign of death. White represents purity, perfection and nobility. The Hearts court are driven by justice, emotion and piety.
Diamonds- Red and Yellow: In addition to Red, Yellow connotes earthly power, desire and lust. The Diamonds court are associated with their power over material wealth.
Clubs- Black and Green: In addition to Black, Green deals with Earth, nature and fertility. While the Queen was the protector of homes, her husband the King and their son the Jack are Gods of War.
Here are the suit markers created for this deck:
After the research, sketching and final coloring were complete, here are the court cards and a short description for each one...
Odin, the King of Spades- Odin is the Æsir's supreme deity, holding his spear Gungnir. For Odin, wine was both food and drink. This card was inspired by a work you can find at http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Odin,_der_Göttervater.jpg
Frigga, the Queen of Spades- Frigga, chief of the Norse goddesses. She was Odin's wife and mother of Balder, the King of Hearts. The inspiration for this work was found at http://emg-zine.com/item.php?id=787 I tested this link at about 9:30 EST January 14 and got an SQL error. I posted the image in Update #2.
Hugin and Munin, the Jack of Spades- Hugin and Munin (Thought and Memory) were Odin's Ravens, often shown perched on Odin's shoulder.They flew throughout the universe each day and told Odin what they had seen. The King of Spades' image has his crows around his throne, which prompted this image.
Balder, the King of Hearts- Balder was the god of innocence and piety, pure to the point that light literally shined from him. His wife was Nanna, the Queen of Hearts. You can see the inspiration in the project video and at http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/ea/Each_arrow_overshot_his_head_by_Elmer_Boyd_Smith.jpg
Nanna, the Queen of Hearts- Nanna was Balder's wife and the mother of Forseti, the Jack of Hearts. Nanna's heart was fatally broken when she saw Balder had died and was laid upon the funeral pyre beside her husband. A statue from 1857 that prompted this work may be found at http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e8/Nanna_%281857%29_by_H._W._Bissen.jpg
Forseti, the Jack of Hearts- The Norse god of justice and conciliation; he always found a resolution to disputes. The loose inspiration for this image is at http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/6/6e/Forseti_zu_Gericht_sitzend.jpg
Njord, the King of Diamonds- Njord commanded the winds, seas and fire, and gave supplicants wealth at sea and in "the chase." He comes from http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/9/95/Nj%C3%B6rd%27s_desire_of_the_Sea.jpg
Skade, the Queen of Diamonds- A Giantess, she joined the Æsir and chose Njord as her husband from among several men of whom she could only see their feet! She was given that opportunity as compensation for her father's murder. This card comes from the original which may be found at http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/6/6c/Skade_by_Saltza.jpg
Frey, the Jack of Diamonds- Stronger and more valorous than his father, Njord, Frey governed weather and agriculture and thus had prosperity, joy and peace under his control. Check out Frey's inspiration at http://emg-zine.com/item.php?id=787. As with Frigga, the Queen of Spades, I received an SQL error when I visited the site the morning of January 14. I posted the image in Update #2.
Thor, the King of Clubs- After Odin, Thor was the main Æsir god.He guarded humans and their work from the Giants (forces of nature). He could make his hammer Mjollnir any size he wanted, throw it to strike his enemy, and have it return to his hand.The image consulted for this card may be found at http://emg-zine.com/item.php?id=787 I received the same SQL error as with the other emg-zine.com links and posted the image as part of Update #2.
Sif, the Queen of Clubs- Thor's wife, known for her beauty and golden hair created by Dwarves. Sif was seen as the protector of homes. This image comes from http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a6/Sif_from_Swedish_Edda_translation.jpg
Modi, the Jack of Clubs- According to mythology.wikia.com/wiki/Modi, Modi was "the god of battle wrath and served as the patrons for berserkers of Norse legends.The berserkers looked to him prior to battle so as to successfully go into the trance...during which they would kill all in their way, friend or foe." I didn't find any historic art for Modi, so I gave my design teammate an idea of him and he produced this very nice piece.

Loki, the Joker- Known as "The Trickster" to many westerners, Loki was crafty and malicious and operated with two faces, ultimately the Æsir's enemy. The "two face" concept is quite interesting and my brother Curt gave me a great idea I'm working through with my teammates. The loose inspiration for the mask comes from http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/4/40/Processed_SAM_loki.jpg
The Card Back
Norse and Norse-related art provided great inspiration for the card back. The circle in the centers of each half depicts Odin riding on his eight-legged horse Sleipnir, the fastest horse in the world. The design down the sides is a gravestone carving from Bibury, Gloucestershire, England found in Northvegr.org's posting of T.D. Kendrick's 1930 book A History of the Vikings.
Here's a better look at the gravestone carving:
In keeping with the Viking theme, the red card back is the same shade of red as Denmark's national flag!
The Tuck Box
The man is Odin in his typical non-battle guise as an old man with a dusty blue cloak and spear. Odin's full image is available as an art card or print as an add-on. The original work on which Odin is based may be found at http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/1/1d/Georg_von_Rosen_-_Oden_som_vandringsman%2C_1886_%28Odin%2C_the_Wanderer%29.jpg
 Numbered Cards
Here are the Ace-Ten of each suit!
Stretch Goals
Withdrawn! I will be launching the red deck as a separate project :)
Add-ons
Additional Decks (Blue from the beginning, Red after that deck is unlocked)- $11
Art Cards (12 court cards plus 2 Loki Jokers and the Odin art card)- $7. Several of the art cards are in the video, for your reference.
Individual Prints (Look for Project Updates!)- 5"x7"- $3, 10"x14"-$15
Uncut Sheets unlocked for Blue at $10,000, Red at $17,000!- $25
Plus, a crossover promotion! See Update 5 for details.
Please let me know of any suggested add-ons you would like for me to consider.

campaign.story:
Johnny Whaam’s original art work of the Old Masters playing cards (made new) is a truly stunning piece of art! Our goal, with the help of Kickstarter, is to get this classic playing card deck in art museum gift shops around the world! Printed by the USPPC, and branded by Bicycle on their classic air cushion finish, this beautifully designed playing card deck is bound to be a delight for art lovers everywhere.
This collection starts with the Mona Lisa tuck case in a deep sea green color theme. We are also offering 2500 limited edition numbered tuck cases. Plus stretch goals for up to 4 additional tuck case designs. limited to a print of only 1000 each.
Each playing card deck will include all 54 ORIGINAL designs. The limited edition 2500 print deck will feature a red back card design.
Johnny puts his own small spin on the artwork, sure to make the original artist smile. Look for the hidden pips in each of the court cards.
It has been a huge challenge for me to work on this project. I've always been greatly inspired by old paintings. The very base of development of my painting skills comes from painters that through centuries created such masterpieces I couldn't get enough looking at...and visually absorbing the themes, shapes, colors literally for hours. As a kid I used to open an art book and then I'd get stuck on just one page for a long time, watching the details, wondering if I'll ever be able to paint something like that.
Well, long story short ;), playing cards design that you see here is truly an homage to all those creators that I sometimes envy for they've lived in a time without such many...technological distractions (internet, games, movies...) that sometimes make it hard(er) for a 21st century guy to focus on drawing and painting.
 It has been difficult to choose what paintings to re-create and take the person originally painted from the context of the author's theme and place him/her in another context, that of...playing cards. I didn't want to change much details and I needed the positions and expressions to fit the card placement and work as a mirrored picture, as a playing card should be...
 I also had to limit the painters to number 14 (12 courts + 2 jokers) so... I was very careful choosing the artists. Each of these presented in the deck is a very famous and significant artist, from different periods in time, a true master.

As you can see in the video, all work, all painting has been done digitally. The process is the same as traditional, the tool is brush,... color palette to choose from, blank canvas, on screen :)
 I'm very satisfied with the final result,...after countless hours of hard work but also a very enjoyable and exciting time spent in front of the screen I hope, with your help...we can all have this design, this...creative product, printed on paper and in our hands.. Thank you all for your support.. Johnny Whaam
 Johnny originally painted the Michelangelo David statue without the cloth, true to the original. Due to legal issues with USPPC they asked us to cover the privates. If you pledge for the puzzle set, you will receive a puzzle with the original art, without the cloth.  
 Add $30.00 to your pledge for standard (Green) Uncut Sheet and $50.00 for the Limited Edition (Red) Uncut Sheet. These are not posters, but a genuine sheet of cards removed from the press before being punched out and packaged.

campaign.story:
FREE black deck with rewards $30 and up!!!
(see stretch goals at bottom for more details)
At first sight the Different Deck is a standard deck of 54 playing cards with one major difference -  each card is inverted so instead of a 3 of clubs, you have a club of 3s.
Instead of a 5 of diamonds, it is a diamond made up of 5s and so on.
Each card is a unique piece of art filled with symbolism and hidden elements. If you look closely at the queen of spades you will see "queen" not only written in several languages, but you will find a queen chess piece and even a Queen Elizabeth signature.
I have been developing this deck for nearly 8 years.  I worked with several artists until about a year ago when I found Nike, an artist from Florida, who could finally bring what I have seen in my mind all these years to life.  For the last ten months we have worked closely together deciding what would go into each and every card.
Every dot, every swirl, every language, and every hidden item was placed where it was placed with thought and purpose.

The more you look at a card and the more you look for hidden elements, the more you will find - things like ambigrams and words sharing letters, like the "T" in one word making an "X" in another.
There are over 100 different languages and numeric systems represented in this deck, plus there is symbolism and imagery in each card as well (an ant on a queen, or a toy jack on a jack, or an 8 ball on an 8, and so on).  There are some really fun things in subjects ranging from science and math, to history and mythology.
A Bit About Me
I am a magician and the founder of www.TeachByMagic.com where we show educators how to use simple magic in the classroom to engage students and make learning more fun and more memorable.

I have worked as a creative consultant for several companies and I love the creative process.  I even do workshops on creativity.

I have been married for almost 12 years to my best friend in the world and although we have been trying for almost nine years, we have not yet had kids. 

So with that extra time and money we have traveled the world.

We have been to Egypt, Italy, France, Denmark, England, Turkey, China, Brazil, Greece, Honduras, Scotland, Alaska, and Ireland. We have touched the pyramids, kissed the Blarney Stone, stood on the Great Wall, seen Stonehenge, and climbed Mayan ruins.

I am fascinated with the mystique behind these landmarks and I have have been working on this Different Deck during it all - learning about cards and numbers in these different cultures. For example, while in China I noticed the elevators did not have 4th floors.  Sure enough, the number 4 is unlucky in Chinese so we never put Chinese characters on any of the 4s.  
Enough About Me, Let's Talk About the Cards!

This project will create three decks of cards.  Two are Kickstarter exclusive Bicycle branded versions of the Different Deck (white and black) and they are both Kickstarter limited editions, only available to backers of this project Never to be reprinted.  I will not sell this version ever again or anywhere else but here, during THIS project.
The faces of the white cards will be exactly like the unlimited edition decks except they will be on white cards rather than the antique parchment style.  The back of the Bicycle Limited Edition Deck is a custom design done by the same artist, again chock-full of symbolism and hidden imagery.  (If you look closely you can see that the word "bicycle" is hidden in the deck several times - how many can you find?)
The faces of the black cards again are exactly like the unlimited edition decks except they will be charcoal colored rather than the antique parchment style.  The back is the same as the white Deck only black instead of red. 
The unlimited edition of the Different Deck will have the classic old paper style to it and this is the deck I hope to get into a corner store.  This has always been a bucket list item for my life.  I have developed several products (and even have a patent on one!) that have been in magic shops and that has been fun to walk into a shop and see my product.  But I want to walk into a normal store and see something I made.  

So with your help, hopefully 2014 will be the year that dream comes true.  And I will keep you posted in the backer updates about my progress as I pitch the deck to all the different stores.  You will know when I make the trek to Bentonville to talk to the Wal-Mart buyers.  And the more backers this project has, the more likely I will have success on that journey.

Also, because this is the Different Deck there will be a few surprises along the way.  The biggest surprise will be the back design of the unlimited version.  That will be revealed when you crack open your reward for the first time. 

I have a non-Bicycle back design that I plan to use but, fully embracing the fact that this is the Different Deck and this is a community effort to bring it to life, I am opening up the back design to you.  If you have a design you would like to submit, please message me for details on that.

If we use your back design you will get a case (144) of decks so you can give one to all your friends after you take them to Walgreen's to show them you designed something they can buy at a store.

How cool is that?

I will post updates here every few days but if you want to see a new card every day make sure to like my Something Facebook page:
I promise this will make more sense when you see my next Kickstarter project!
The rewards are simple.  You can get the decks or, if you like, we also have a H.O.P.E. sticker, or decal.
The numbers on this die-cut sticker correspond to the letters on a telephone key pad for hope - 4673.  The size will be approximately 3" x 8".

Uncut Sheets are available and they are set up... well Differently. 

The cards all are mixed, but not in a random order. They are laid out like a crossword puzzle with words spelled out in number form like H.O.P.E. (4673) or L.O.V.E. (5683) but with lots of hidden inspirational words, like "dream", "believe", "imagine"...you get the idea.

Original inkings
There are also 50 original artwork spots. These are the actual hand drawings that were scanned in to make these cards. They are approximately 7" by 10" and are on torn edged Stonehenge paper – and they will look AMAZING framed.
These come unframed so you can do whatever you like with them - but here is what it might look like if you framed it with 4 cards.

One Lucky Backer will get the 4 original H.O.P.E. inkings framed in a leather stitched frame with double matting, an inner fillet around each card, and museum  quality glass.
 It is 24" high and 55" wide and it looks AMAZING.

Here are the items you can add.  If you have any questions please don't hesitate to ask.

campaign.story:
Ocean Ambassadors are a group of highly motivated high school students who wish to work with younger students to help restore the ocean.  The Ocean Ambassadors seek to enhance ocean environmental education on a local and national scale by creating a documentary called "Beneath the Sea - Explore to Restore".  The documentary is intended to raise ocean awareness and create a stewardship that will help to restore the ocean for future generations.
The documentary will be distributed by Ocean Ambassadors to students in elementary schools along the coast of Maine in 2014.  While visiting the elementary schools to deliver the documentary the Ocean Ambassadors will explain the importance of collecting and recycling ocean debris.  They will work with the students to teach them how they can get involved and help restore the ocean.  As the students explore the ocean with us by watching the documentary they will learn how lost traps, when left to rot on the sea-floor pollute not only the ocean environment, but also the livelihoods of our fishing communities . 
When watching the documentary Elementary students will virtually dive with our Ocean Ambassador teams as they participate in near coastal open water dives accompanied by dive professionals, instructors and mentors who will locate and remove ghost gear (dead lobster traps and other ocean debris) in the shallow water.  In deeper waters the Ambassadors will use Remotely Operated Unmanned Submersibles to show the effect ghost gear has on the ocean environment and the benefits that come from removing this debris.
Each year large numbers of traps are lost in the ocean.  As Ocean Ambassadors we feel our efforts and our documentary will support a healthy ocean environment and help restore resources that once thrived in the Gulf of Maine.  We are not 100% sure what these ghost traps do to the ocean environment, but as Ocean Ambassadors we are about to find out.
We appreciate your support of our efforts to create the Ocean Ambassador's documentary - Beneath the Sea - Explore to Restore
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Fisheries management officials say the process of recovering these traps is more than simply diving down to remove the gear. We will have to obtain permits and permission from state officials and fishermen who work in the zones we plan to explore. This process will be explained in the documentary in hopes to make future restoration projects more effective.

In preparation for the documentary we have already begun communicating with local fishermen to ask for their permission and help in removing the ghost gear from the water once it has been located and marked. By working together the fishermen have the opportunity to reclaim fishable gear that has been lost when it hung down beneath obstacles on the sea-floor or has cut off by unsuspecting boaters - and by removing trash traps they open up valuable fishing bottom for the future.

A trilogy of playing card decks inspired by the French Revolution!
Deck Features:
Printed by the USPCC
Three Decks
Bicycle Paper
Magic Finish
Unique Courts
Unique Jokers
Unique Aces
Unique Pips
Unique Backs
-
The Révolution Deck
The Révolution deck contains a blue back with design inspired by 18th century ornaments and French Revolutionary symbolism. You'll find iconic images such as: la Marianne, le Coq, tricolor flags, wheat, and the national emblem of France held by statues of Hercules.
It also has a unique pair of the King / Queen of Diamonds portrayed by King Louis xvi and Queen Marie Antoinette without their crown and hair boat. It also contains two unique jokers: a sans-culotte holding a tricolor flag and a woman on her march to Versailles.
-
The Reign Deck
The Reign deck is inspired by the events of the Reign of Terror (1793-1794). The guillotine is the main focus of the back design. Supporting elements include a woman drowning in water (representing the Drowning of Nantes) and a pair of hooded figures that can be found in 18th century tomb designs. All on a nice white background.
The most noticeable difference between this deck and the other two are all of the court cards. Every court card figure has been a victim of the guillotine and to reflect that, every court has had their heads cut off! Oh no! Also included in the white deck is a pair of unique jokers, which display the guillotine itself.
-
The Régime Deck
The Régime deck's back design contains elements alluding to royalty and the Ancien Régime. Royal ornaments and flourishes fill the borders, while symbols of Christianity and the Monarchy can be found throughout the rest of the design. If you look closely you can spot doves, fleur de lis, and the royal emblem held by a pair of angels.
Like the Révolution deck, the Régime deck contains two unique King / Queen of Diamonds cards. This time around they have their crown and hair boat on. Bling! Also, like the other two decks, there are two unique jokers. One of King Louis xvi looking regal with his fine self and a fumbling, stumbling, drunk! Someone should cut his head off...oh wait...
-
The Aces
Each of the Aces has their own enlarged pip.
Hearts - this pip is a graphic representation of the insignia of Vendean Royalists. History of the War of the Vendée can be found here.
Diamonds - a graphic version of the cross of the Order of the Holy Spirit.
Clubs - a really abstract and...you guessed it...graphic...version of the Tree of Liberty
Spades - a spade created from the fleur de lis...with a little extra pizzazz!
-
The Court
The King of Diamonds - Louis XVI of France
-
The Queen of Diamonds - Marie Antoinette
-
 The King of Clubs - Georges Danton
-
 The Queen of Spades - Charlotte Corday
-

The Jokers

campaign.story:
What are Fontaines?
Fontaines are a deck of cards I designed one night in photoshop for fun. I made one prototype deck, started using it in my videos, and people couldn't stop asking to buy them! 
I made an indiegogo campaign for the Red Fontaines on Feb 15, 2013. Within 18 hours, we met our $10,000 goal. Before the end of the month, we made over $21k. The Red Fontaines sold out. I only have a few decks left for myself, and they are now selling for up to $60 EACH on eBay. Everyone, including myself, wanted more Fontaines.
The only place left to find Red Fontaines is on eBay - that's the price PER deck! Crazy!!
BACK IN BLUE
Ever since the Red Fontaines were released, I've been asked CONSTANTLY by hundreds of people on the internet begging for a blue edition of Fontaines. The time has finally come. 
The Blue Fontaines are available RIGHT NOW - with YOUR HELP! This time we are trying to printing 5,000 decks and we need $20,000 to do it up right.
The Deck
Fontaines started with just a back design. Now, every deck will come printed on classic bicycle stock with linen finish, perfect for cardists and magicians alike. 
The Ace of Spaces is simple, streamlined and elegant, featuring the Fontaine box logo running through the center of the Spade. 
The Jokers also sport the blue box logo with the fontaine F for pips. A Blank Faced card is included for magicians - to use in various effects. Seal? You mean the lint magnets and tuck box killers of the world? No seal, my friend. Not today. 
The Box has a utility device for magicians built right into the design. My friend Michael Stern and I developed a concept called The Vintage Holdout that is a slight alteration you make to a card box that opens the doors to TONS of amazing tricks - the downside is it only works with these Vintage Series bicycle decks. Until now. I built the same method right into the box design. Learn it here.
The Perks!
In additional to decks on decks, we also have hoodies, shirts, bricks, uncut sheets and a personal favorite perk of mine, FONTAINE CARD CLIPS!! 
The Brick
Twelve Blue Fontaine Decks - sealed with a fontaine sticker.
Blue Fontaine T-Shirt
Comes with one Blue Fontaine deck.
Embroidered Blue Fontaine Hoodie
It's a hoodie. It's got an embroidered Fontaine logo. Real comfy. Comes with one Blue Fontaine Deck.
Fontaine x Dan and Dave x Joe Porper Card Clip
These are beautiful, leather-wrapped Joe Porper Card Clips made by Dan and Dave Buck. It features the Fontaine logo engraved into the leather, and the Joe Porper and DnD logos on the inner spine. Comes with one Blue Fontaine Deck.
Uncut Sheet 
$19! DAT CRAZY PRICE THO! Add $25 for international shipping.
Impossible Bottle - Made by Jamie D. Grant
A sealed Blue Fontaine deck trapped inside an un-altered milk bottle. Handmade in Canada by Jamie D. Grant. Comes with one additional Blue Fontaine Deck.
Deck Add-On Guide
Want the Porper Card Clip but also more decks? Simply follow the add-on guide below - once you've added your total to your pledge, shoot me a message letting me know exactly what you want to add.
Example: U.S. Backer wants to add 4 more Decks of Blue Fontaines to their current pledge. 
 Current Pledge: $20 - 2 Decks of Blue Fontaines ADD: $39 (4 Decks) to current pledge for a total of $59.
Example: International Backer wants to add 4 more Decks of Blue Fontaines to their current pledge. 
 Current Pledge: $20 - 2 Decks of Blue Fontaines. ADD: $39 (4 Decks) + $18 (6 Decks Shipping total) to current pledge for a total of $77.
The Pricing
Every perk on the campaign includes free shipping within the USA, so if that $12 price tag on one deck scares you, realize that it's going to cost me anywhere from $3-5 to ship that one deck in an envelope to your doorstep. And also the price of the envelope. That's included if you live in the USA. 
If you're thinking $12 bucks even with shipping is still a lot, I agree. The more decks you buy, the cheaper the price, so get your costco mentality and buy in bulk. Or don't. It's really up to you.
This is a fixed funding campaign, meaning if you purchase any of our perks and we don't reach our goal of $20,000 within 30 days - you will get your money back! :D
International Shipping
Last time I did a crowdfunding campaign, I charged $8 across all perks, and I lost about $3,000 in extra international shipping costs! It was a sad day. Some bricks cost me $75 to send!! So the international prices are averaged. Sorry if they are a bit pricey - mail is lame!

campaign.story:
The inspiration for this deck comes from my love of playing poker and vintage playing card backs. There has been so many great looking theme decks come to kickstarter in the past, many of them are like miniature art and will be highly sought after for there collectable value, and some are just a little to busy making playing somewhat difficult. My goal was to design a fresh and creative look at the standard deck of cards with the ease of a highly playable experience. At first glance they my appear to be just that “standard cards” (other then the obvious, face's) but each court card has been changed in someway or another, some have major changes and others will be slightly harder to find the differences.
 All cards will have the Bicycle famous “embossed finish” for superior handling, on Bicycle grade paper.
 The Jokers I designed, I wanted them to fall in line with the court cards. Not to often will you find a female Joker in the deck, so I knew this would be a must for me to add one. Each of the Jokers are labeled with the star and circle for their identification.
  The tucks, all are the same but different in someway or another, they are almost like a seek and find. I am still adding to the little details here and there, but the over all concept will remain the same. 
  Each of the tucks are labeled with one of the following Cambric, Linoid, Magic and Linen finish. Some my argue that they are still different but when I checked on the “linoid finish” in one of many emails, I was answered and I quote “Correct: linoid, cambric, linen, air-cushion, magic are all different ways to describe our embossed finish. Thanks! “
Many creators will design a limited tuck with the same cards and branding, I could have taken that route but wanted to take it one step beyond that. So for the first time ever on Kickstarter I am bringing the Tally-Ho and Bee brand into play. The two brands Tally-Ho and Bee will be released as a stretch goal. 
Once the stretch goal for the Bee deck is reached, all cards in every brand will be upgraded to Bee stock paper. Just to clarify the difference in the paper I will quote from USPCC once again “We use the same paper stock for both our Bicycle and Bee Grade papers. Bee is just crushed to a very slightly thicker caliper.” 
Tally-Ho playing cards were first introduced in 1885 the same year as the Bicycle 808 
The first Bee playing cards were manufactured in 1892 and quickly become the top choice for casino use, and remain to be the favorite among all poker players
 During my last project I learned that some International Backers have to pay an import tax. To help out as much as I can, I will mark all custom forms as a gift and keep the total amount between $2 and $10 depending on the size of the package. 
 I wanted to make the USPCC FACTS known, There is some misleading information out about the Paper and Finishes available. This information and more is given to creators when they contact USPCC about there project and can be found in “Custom Order Form” file. Along with the information from USPCC and endless emails I have spent time on the phone talking with there Business Development Manager going over different options about this project. Since this is the first project to offer cross branding by using the Bicycle, Tally-Ho and Bee brand I left no stones unturned when it came to questions.
USPCC is allowing me to split my minimum order between the unbranded and 3 branded decks, in return giving this project a realistic chance to succeed. As many of you know a minimum order from USPCC is 2500 decks, unless you use Bee grade paper. By using Bee paper the new minimum goes to 5000 decks.

campaign.story:
HELP US CONTINUE THE 4PM DESIGNS COLLECTION WITH...LEGACY
Bicycle® Legacy
Since 1885, the USPCC has printed their most popular and demanded brand of playing cards around the world, Bicycle. Although there has been many variations of their back designs, one has remained the most influential, the "rider back". The design has been color swapped, and modified to fit other themes, but overall the design has stayed the same. With keeping in the tradition of what makes the design great, we have worked with the USPCC to push what makes the rider back great and bring you a new design inspired by the original. A design which keeps the integrity of what we are familiar with, yet something new to add to its LEGACY. BICYCLE LEGACY is a TRUE set of unique poker cards. This means both decks have identical faces with 2 back color variations. Hand drawn courts, aces, and joker cards add to the decks appeal while a simplistic layout keeps the deck familiar. This makes LEGACY a great deck for performers of magic and cardistry, while bringing something fresh to your weekend poker games.
